items.title: Train cancelled on partner's birthday
items.review_text:
Train cancelled on partner's birthday , day trip to Edinburgh . Trying to get 
 refund is horrendous. Claim refused as they state no record held. Despite sending reference no etc. Booked on lumo website , tickets uploaded . Can only upload 3 pics which is useless . Sent an e mail returned by system as spam. Shocking customer service

items.title: No buffet car and buffet trolly does…
items.review_text:
No buffet car and buffet trolly does not reach you on the Kings Cross to Newcastle service. Almost 3 hrs without food or water and no apologies or info about why half of the train is completely neglected.
LNER far superior

items.title: Attempted to purchase ticket
items.review_text: Attempted to purchase ticket, no ticket was provided but money taken from bank. When emailing customer service I was asked to check junk or explore if I purchased via another email. I was advised the refund can take up to 10 days and in some cases 28 (depending on bank) I then queried this - the response was identical to the original response I was querying . Use Lumo weekly - will likely now use LNER.

items.title: Golfers not welcome on LUMO trains
items.review_text:
Bought a ticket via Trainline... Told whilst waiting to board, NO golf clubs allowed on the train... Just a carry bag that fits in overhead... DON'T buy if golf clubs with you...

P.S. LNER, no issue no hassle...

items.title: Never again
items.review_text: Booked on the Newcastle to Kings X on 16th March. Bearing in mind this train starts in Scotland it was only around an hour before it was due that it was reported cancelled. Because there were no other Lumo trains that night I was told that my only alternative was to pay way over the odds for an immediate LNER ticket. A decent company would reimburse me for my additional loss, not just offer a refund. Will never use Lumo again. It's amazing how in most countries I've been to the trains just work and are on time. Short notice cancellation with no compensation is not a way to gain goodwill

items.title: Safety - NO windows are openable even by crew
items.review_text: Realising no windows opened we researched-Safety - these trains have no removable windows. Previously-Trapped panicked passengers in heat reported horror as electrics failed leaving them roasting. One points out ‘only time before fatalities’ . What about in an accident?! Will not be using again. Why is safety second place to revenue!

items.title: Should be called VETO
items.review_text: Should be called VETO. Won’t be using them again. Trip from London KX to Edinburgh. There is no airflow in the carriages. Humid and cramped. Stick to LNER, worth the extra cost.

items.title: Travelling on 12.41 train from Stevenage to Newcastle
items.review_text: Travelling on 12.41 train from Stevenage to Newcastle on 27 December 2023 back seats coach E)  Cabin crew (dark haired lady-maybe called Karen and leaving train at Newcastle) exceptional.  Credit to the company.  Despite overcrowded train with massive amount of luggage everywhere was cheerful, helpful and very pleasant.  Seemed to be doing every job. Up and down with refreshment trolley. Up and down checking tickets and up and down collecting rubbish.  Worth her weight in gold!!!!  Pay this lady more - definitely earned it this journey🤗

items.title: Trying to claim delay repay
items.review_text: Trying to claim delay repay. Mobile app interface is not fit for purpose. Not accepting PDF file or booking reference. After trying numerous times I called Customer Support. They were utterly useless!! This is after a four hour delay yesterday afternoon/evening! Would give them zero if possible. Shocking.

items.title: Cancellations aside
items.review_text:
Cancellations aside, the train company have a luggage policy which means you can be refused to travel if your bags are too big. 

The seats are tiny and with the growing population, don't be surprised to share a seat allocated to you. 

The air temperature must be set at around 40 degrees. Regardless of time of year or weather, you will be boiling for your entire journey. 

The company only accept refunds if you book through their own website. Trainline bookings or other refunds will be rejected.

All in all, 1 star. Avoid if possible.

items.title: Try it I bet you like it :)
items.review_text:
If you are going from London to Newcastle on a budget ( or with a Railcard) this is way to go.

Smaller 4 carriage trains than LNER with only a pickup stop at Stevenage.

So past Stevenage everyone spreads out to get a double seat to themselves without fear of having to move later.

items.title: Horrendous
items.review_text:
Absolutely horrendous experience travelling from Edinburgh to London today. 

The train was so hot and they couldn’t turn on the air con. There is no space for baggage so all small suitcases have to go overhead and there is nowhere near enough space. 2 members of staff for the whole train and not possible
To go and purchase any food / water when you feel like it, you have to wait until they come round with the trolley once every 2 hours. 

The toilet was absolutely disgusting and the floor was soaking wet. 

Really expected more from the journey but will make a conscious effort never to travel via Lumo again.

items.title: Absolutely terrible idea
items.review_text:
Absolutely terrible idea, will never use again. Ryanair on rails.
Got charged 30 quid extra for taking a golf bag full of cosplay costume!
Trainline should delist Lumo trains or make you click confirming you have read their ridiculous luggage policy.
Wasn't even any cheaper than a normal train.

They cherry pick most profitable customers only , barely any luggage space per carriage, absolute budget airline morals.
I hope they fail within a short amount of time and an actual national train operator gets all their slots.

Avoid if going to any kind of event.

items.title: Run by 'Worst Group'
items.review_text:
First has been known as 'Worst' for many years.

"FirstGroup, the rail and bus operator, has produced nothing, except fury and poverty in its customers and fat profits for its shareholders, writes Andrew Gilligan."

(The Telegraph)


"First Capital Connect has been named as the worst train operating company in the country after only four out of 10 commuters said they were satisfied with the Bedford to Brighton franchise"

 (The Guardian)

As Mick O'Leary says: "Our planes are full of people who hate us!"

items.title: Never buy a Lumo ticket
items.review_text: We were supposed to catch the 1613 hrs Lumofixed train from Edinburgh Waverley to King’s X on the 13th Nov. The train left without announcement on the departure board - how on earth is this possible - with a bunch of stranded passengers!! We were prevented from boarding LNER trains unless we buy new single-trip tickets to King’s X!!!! Never book your tickets through Lumo and never again!!

items.title: No refreshments on this journey
items.review_text:
Train was on time, staff friendly enough but really dissatisfied that you couldn't get drinks or snacks on this journey.
We asked could you go to the buffet carriage to get drinks/snacks we were told wasnt one on this occasion but trolley would come round on this occasion, but only for carriages B & C as not many staff on board. 
Well we waited and waited but no sign of any trolly, other people wanted to buy things as well, my friend went to see if she could see it in the next carriage but couldn't see it. So we sat waiting patiently. 
They came up and down for rubbish twice, not sure why when noome got anything as the trolley never made an appearance. 
It was announced just past Morpeth that we were reaching my stop soon, Newcastle, so I asked where was the trolley on which she replied you should have gone to trolley in carriages B&C as we are running static service, well myself and my friend wasn't happy nor were other passengers on this train
Edinburgh to Newcastle 18.54 platform 7
Carriage B
Definitely not happy
Well we waited and waited

items.title: A company that will cancel it's train and just abandon you
items.review_text: Train from Edinburgh to London Kings Cross cancelled due to a fault on the train an hour before departure. No Lumo staff at station, no contact telephone number, and no attempt by company to make any alternative arrangements for stranded passengers...their response ? ...they just abandon customers to their fate and tell them over twitter to go buy tickets with LNER !!!!!!. Absolutely atrocious...do yourself a favour and avoid this company like the plague ..any company that treats customers like this deserves to go under , and no doubt it will idc when people realise what it's like

items.title: Booked with Trainline
items.review_text: Booked with Trainline, hadn’t heard of this company before, was expecting to see Virgin, however unbeknownst to me they have merged with someone else! Travelled from Edinburgh to King’s Cross return. On both journeys we were freezing 🥶 asked if aircon could be turned off, not possible 😩. However on a positive note seats we had were spacious albeit a bit uncomfortable 😳. Now that I’m more clued up I doubt I will travel with them again. 😟

items.title: No power, dreadful "coffee", intermittent WiFi
items.review_text:
Lumo advertises wifi, power sockets, catering service - well, my journey from London to Edinburgh on afternoon of 23 October was different.
The power socket (only one for two seats??) did not work, the WiFi was very "iffy", the brown water called coffee was undrinkable.
LNER are not the world's best but so much better than this. I will not use Lumo again

items.title: Such a pleasant journey
items.review_text:
On 19.58 Edinburgh to London train. Soaked through, exhausted from week of work and welcomed by the nicest staff member Craig! Such vibrant energetic tannoys and engagement with passengers when checking tickets / doing trolley. Really made my day! 
First time on Lumo train and very clean and spacious, will be using again in future. Thank you Craig for starting my weekend so positively 😀.

items.title: Travelled Morpeth to King’s Cross…
items.review_text: Travelled Morpeth to King’s Cross return, we were lucky to catch our out bound train which departed Morpeth 5 minutes before the advertised time. Coming back from King’s Cross our train was cancelled just 10 minutes before departure.  Man at the Lumo desk told us their next and only other train was a three hour wait but advised us not to rely on it as that would probably be cancelled also - best advice was to buy another ticket on LNER which at short notice cost £350.  So far no refund from Lumo and we are told no chance of compensation. Definitely a company to avoid

items.title: Fantastic Train
items.review_text:
Fantastic Train
Good price, train came in early, left on time on both journeys. Drinks trolley very reasonable priced.
Driver updated passengers when stopped at a red light.
If you intend to travel with large luggage DONT book. The website & posters in the station clearly state the luggage allowance which was perfectly adequate for myself & husband. We had one medium case & rucksack between us however had to travel with the case & rucksack squashed in front of us as the luggage racks were rammed with large cases when we got on the train. Just before departure a member of staff removed extra large cases and ran down the platform to another part of the train. Consequently those spare spaces were immediately stuffed with more luggage.

items.title: London Kings X to Newcastle today and…
items.review_text:
London Kings X to Newcastle today and the train was on time, ample room for our 2 large cases and storage space.
Lovely and friendly staff throughout, the male and female trolly cart people were super nice.
Nothing at all to say negative about the service, chairs were not the most comfortable but it got me where I needed to be :)

items.title: Incorrect refund information on website
items.review_text: Following my last review, my second letter came back unopened today after 5 weeks, because the Freepost address,on their own website, has been wrong. Royal mail asked for £2.50. After a lengthy message exchange with Lumo, they now recognise "issues" with the Freepost address. Only last week I sent them pdfs, and they refunded me. At last, so annoying

items.title: Travelled yesterday from Morpeth to…
items.review_text: Travelled yesterday from Morpeth to Kings Cross. Have travelled many times with other carriers. Have to say this is the best train journey ever. Great design of train, spacious interior. On time. Staff absolutely fantastic. They carried out their job with a great sense of humour but didn’t let their professional attitude suffer for this. What a difference from other carriers. Will not use anyone else going forward. Please don’t let other negative comments put you off booking. Sometimes people look for problems when they don’t exist.

items.title: No tray tables (again…)
items.review_text: You would hope in 21st century Britain that trains would have tray tables. I have travelled on Lumo twice with the intention to work and both times have been met with fully booked trains and no table. Utterly pathetic. I would be willing to deal with this major inconvenience should the train be cheaper than other operators but for little to no difference in price I would thoroughly recommend avoiding all Lumo services. 1/5 stars.

items.title: No refund for disrupted service.
items.review_text:
I booked 3 tickets from Edinburgh Waverley to London King's Cross. 16:13pm. (Complaint reference number LMO-1183-038-042)

The train was indicated as delayed and then it disappeared off all the boards. There were a whole bunch of customers waiting but did not know which of the 20 platforms to go to. 
The train just left and we were asked to wait 4 hours for the next one.

Lump customer service refused to give any compensation or even acknowledge their fault. They rudely asked me for evidence (how is the end user going to access station CCTV?)

There's a constant shift of responsibility and absolutely terrible reliability. I will never book a Limo ticket again, worth paying extra for LNER or any other competitor.

items.title: Enjoying our journey
items.review_text:
Comfortable seats, plenty of legroom and lovely staff.
We only brought one suitcase each (as permitted by the Lumo website), and have nothing to whinge about.
We are currently travelling north, train is on time….
Understand it is fully electric….another positive.

items.title: The budget option
items.review_text:
Like reviewer PT I was booked on the 16.13 Edinburgh to King's Cross and confirm that having been told to wait with no platform showing, the train then disappeared off the board with no announcements. By searching the station I did find the train which left soon after. Probably not Lumo's fault. Similarly recent delays are mainly down to some single line working north of Newcastle due to a structural fault on a bridge.

Lumo is certainly the cheap option and the seats are apparently slightly more spacious than LNER Standard. However you do feel crammed in with very little luggage space. My seat had no window. Staff were cheerful but not a great way to spend 4.5 hours or enjoy one of the more picturesque European railway journeys.

items.title: Luggage Issues
items.review_text:
My wife and I were travelling back to Newcastle after a trip to Florida 
We were met on the platform by an officious job's worth
Who said you can't travel on our trains with golf clubs.
We had to rebook our seats with LNER at an additional cost and hopefully will receive a refund of our original tickets.
Nice way to treat to 70 year old returning from a special birthday treat
They don't have a category for zero stars for customer service

items.title: Awful company avoid at all costs blond…
items.review_text: Awful company avoid at all costs blond member of staff on the Morpeth 8.56 to Edinburgh on 11/12/23'shouted at me for trying to walk to my carriage when THEY  WERE 8 MINUTES LATE telling me I should hurry cheeky to say the least then when we did get on they kept promising us the trolley would be coming soon never did get a cuppa absolute joke I would NEVER EVER travel with you again

items.title: Took extra 5 hours on 3hours journey so 8hours in total at the end
items.review_text: Sat in the train delayed more than 5hours while the whole train journey should be just under 3 hours from London to Newcastle so now total taking of 8 hours. While we stuck on hold and there are other trains driving past even the same company train left after us. They prioritise other train as since they don’t want to do more refund for other people. Staff handing water out but because I have bit of milk left and said water is only for people without fluid while a lot of people taking it have some fluid with them. Highly felt like due to I am Chinese and she uses that as an excuse as she didn’t tell other people the same.

items.title: Constantly delayed service
items.review_text: I’ve made the journey from London to Newcastle four times this year. Every single time the train has run at least half an hour late to reach its destination which considering the price of the tickets just isn’t acceptable

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: We arrived at King's Cross before our scheduled departure time only to find our train had already departed 25 minutes early. We then had a very difficult time sorting tickets back to Newcastle. LNER were amazing in helping us out in very difficult circumstances. I will never book a Lumo train again. How do they get away with this type of treatment to customers?

items.title: Constant cancellations- disgraceful service.
items.review_text: 3/5 times I've use Lumo the train has been cancelled from 6 hours to 10 minutes before the journey. Barely any luggage storage, always chaotic. An absolute disgrace of a train service- worth paying the extra to use a different train line to avoid Lumo.

items.title: A serious incident cancelled trains to be…
items.review_text:
A serious incident caused trains to be cancelled and delayed. There was no information on our Lumo train or any Lumo staff to help us .
 We were abandoned by Lumo . We had to be rescued by LNER who staff found out that our train haf been cancelled. They got us on one of their 
 trains and even reserved seats for us 
  Along with their ridiculously small luggage restrictions we won't be going with them again

items.title: Only one out of five toilets working…
items.review_text: Only one out of five toilets working for most of the journey. Which means big queue and we're told to avoid using water for hand washing as there isn't enough. And also told repeatedly that this is Hitachi and Network Rail's fault. Granted they managed a 10 min stop in Newcastle so people could use toilets (if they ran!). But take responsibility for the service being sub-standard!

items.title: Shocking website
items.review_text: Shocking website, even worse customer support. My booking wouldn't show up on my account even though customer support could see it. I tried to change my train but kept getting the same response which was "please go to your bookings via our website". They also cannot change the booking via the support chat or phone. Useless

items.title: Lumo experience a disgrace. Train cancellation without warning due…
items.review_text:
Train cancellation without warning due to derailment in Edinburgh. Told to get on another train line which we did, Lumo staff from derailment train on same coach, they had a lovely time sitting down enjoying their time not advising displaced Lumo travellers what to do which station to get off at or providing Customer service disgraceful. We were left on a train without a valid ticket, told to get off at York station  and wait to hours for the next train. Had reserved seats for months however when we got on the train on seats available  from York to Kings Cross station. To say I am angry is a understatement. If I could give Lumo transport less than a one I would. 
Lumo is a disgrace.

items.title: Just fly instead
items.review_text:
Just as unreliable and **** as every other train company in this terrible country. 

Also they claim to offer automatic refunds if you book the tickets through them directly but this isn’t true. You have to register with a separate account to request a refund, and the process is insanely annoying. 

Next time I’ll just fly, it’s cheaper and more reliable.

items.title: Like many other reviews kings cross to Edinburgh
items.review_text: Like many other reviews, the buffet service is not fit for purpose.  After 2 hours on the train from Kings cross i located the trolley but was refused a hot drink ( they don't encourage passengers carrying coffee through the carriage. (LNER bag the hot drinks)They informed me they would be with me within 30mins.  They then announced people from coach A & B could make their way to coach C but no hot drinks could be purchased due to a fault, call me cynical! or maybe just a coincidence.  Really need to sort this out, poor service

items.title: Massive thank you to Lumo today whose…
items.review_text: Massive thank you to Lumo today whose staff were helpful and efficient in very difficult circumstances. Amazing service. Very much appreciated all the effort your staff on the 12.56hrs Edinburgh to London  train went to (above and beyond). Highly recommend.

items.title: Completely failed to meet my expectations
items.review_text:
Train 36 minutes late. Broken promise to automatically process delay replays, so you need to register on another site and add endless details. Customer service emails promise to respond in 20 days, which for a travel company is effectively never.

You'd have thought a challenger company would do this better. Back to LNER for me, won't travel Lumo again.

items.title: Extremely helpful.
items.review_text:
Extremely helpful.
My wife and I took the 5:48am from Kings Cross to Edinburgh. Could not fault the service, left on time, very fast and efficient service. Our train guard Anthony was extremely helpful with assisting with our heavy luggage and provided helpful seat allocation advice on where best to sit on this busy service. Indeed we found all the staff on this this train to be very courteous.

items.title: This is my second trip with lumo to…
items.review_text: This is my second trip with lumo to Newcastle from London. Excellent service ,the staff are very friendly and helpful. I cannot understand the negative comments from other travellers. The seats are very comfortable and seems bigger than usual. The journey feels smoother than other operators. I will definitely travel with them again

items.title: Booked to travel from london to…
items.review_text:
Booked to travel from london to newcastle. Fortunately we arrived at kings cross very early because the train had been rescheduled to leave 25 mins earlier than the time stated on the tickets, and we had not been notified. We were hoping to grab breakfast but just managed to get the train with seconds to spare ... I expect many weren't so lucky. 
No food available on the train and the wifi didnt work and very little luggage space all added to the fun. Here's hoping we manage to get the train home ok tomorrow.

items.title: Truly excellent experience
items.review_text:
Was so disappointed to read negative reviews prior to my travel but my experience was excellent. 
Carriage spotlessly clean, seats comfortable with good legroom. Plenty of overhead luggage space and space for large luggage.
Used toilet near the end of my journey and it was clean which hasn’t been my experience on other carriers. 
Trolley service with hot/cold drinks and snacks. Take aboard anything more substantial. 
Staff courteous. 
Would absolutely use again and recommend. Really sorry some have had a negative experience.

items.title: Read all 1*reviews here
items.review_text:
So, please, just read all the 1* reviews and you will have a picture.
How come in a first world country the only early train from Kings Cross to Edinburgh is with this company?
 If you like uncomfortable seats at 5:45 am, fasting for 3h, after which you will enjoy even Kit Kat or crisps ( not even an unhealthy sandwich) and all the unhealthy snacks, this train is for you! You can also get embarrassed if you did something wrong (unconsciously) as they will scream loud enough across the corridor.

items.title: Tardy Trolley
items.review_text: Would appreciate it if someone could tell me why the trolley service commenced 1.5 hours after leaving Kings X this morning?? I’m in a coach which may NOT be reached by the trolley by the time we reach Newcastle where I alight?  The manager has asked that if a person is in need of refreshments then to go and find the trolley!! Wouldn’t it be easier to simply put a buffet carriage on. It’s like flying BA - no food unless preordered!!

items.title: Amazing trip from Newcastle to…
items.review_text:
Amazing trip from Newcastle to Edinburgh on Sunday 18th on the 11.46 Lumo train.

The staff were so lovely. I’m sure the gentleman with the refreshment trolley was called Gary. His message to all the passengers when we departed at Edinburgh was so uplifting, one of the girls even cheered. 

Superb value for money, we booked last minute. Train was spotless & the 2 crew members were absolutely brilliant! 

We will be travelling with you again very soon. 

Thank you 🙏 
Claire

items.title: Do not use Lumo with golf clubs
items.review_text: When buying a ticket on Trainline there was no mention of a restriction on luggage. I arrived at Kings Cross with a carry golf bag and a small bag bound for Edinburgh. I was refused access as golf bags are not allowed. The Guard said get a refund and did I not read Terms & Conditions. My tickets proved to be unrefundable. And I had to buy a new £100 ticket to travel on LNER.

items.title: London to Newcastle train
items.review_text:
Train out from Newcastle to London was very full - very limited luggage storage & nowhere for suitcase.
Train back to Newcastle (10:45 service) - snack trolley brought round. One stewardess clearly does not listen, bad customer service attitude & arguementative - so that was appreciated!! Other stewardess could not be more helpful, professional & seemed to want to apologise for her colleague. No more Lumo for me

items.title: Without doubt the most appalling service…
items.review_text: Without doubt the most appalling train service ive ever had the misfortune to use in the UK. They may pride themselves on low fares but when that comes at the cost of overcrowded trains spilling over with luggage (dangerously piled high in the vestibules and falling off racks) they need to rethink. Inevitably, not a single member of staff was seen around to deal with any of the mayhem. May well go to the press with some pictures of their dangerous service. Total shambles, will never use again and will strongly recommend to friends and family to avoid. I see there are many other similar poor reviews on here and can only suspect the positive ones are written by staff, they sound like they are!

items.title: Outstanding
items.review_text: I thought it appropriate to leave some feedback on my journey yesterday. I was on the heavily delayed service from King’s Cross to Edinburgh (1228). The staff on the train were outstanding. It was a very very difficult time as there was lots of delays as the train effectively crawled it’s way to Edinburgh (it took 10 hours roughly) the staff were an absolute credit to any company. I saw them deal with frankly outrageous customers who clearly thought lumo could control the weather with grace and good humour and despite the challenging circumstances remained positive and helpful. I had contact with gary, gary, frosty and Lindsay and would like to make sure they receive the praise they are due for all their hard work yesterday. They made a long day more tolerable and I will definitely use lumo again

items.title: Horrible staff
items.review_text: currently sitting on a lumo train from king’s cross to edinburgh and all i have to say is this is the worst train experience of my life. Rude and incompetent staff on both shifts. Didn’t ask us if we wanted anything from the cart on their way round and refused to take our rubbish because we took a total of 5seconds to gather it together which is apparently too long. Certainly won’t be back on one of these trains ever again. Absolutely despicable service and staff. Also sort out ur storage. Half the passengers were standing with their cases in the walkways because there was no storage space.

items.title: Uncomfortable, cold journey - I’ll never travel with Lumo again
items.review_text:
First of all train was clean and journey was uneventful. However I would never travel with Lumo again.

The seats are rock hard and upright with very little space between the seats. This made a 4.5 hour journey incredibly uncomfortable and my back is still aching 2 hours after. 

There was also an additional charge for “excess luggage”. It didn’t affect me but did other passengers - first I had heard if it was when there was an announcement AFTER the train had departed - very clever!!

Seats we had booked in the quiet coach were not honoured in either of our journeys. And a buffet that does not serve hot food during freezing temperatures is unacceptable. I also think that the heating was shut off about 40 minutes prior to the end of the journey as suddenly the train got very cold.

Never again!

items.title: There is a severe delay on my Wednesday…
items.review_text: There is a severe delay on my Wednesday 19 of July morning trip (7:57 am) from Newcastle to London King’s Cross. We got on the train at 9:10 am and I arrived late in London and was in a hurry and under stress to catch up my international flight. We have been told that this was due to a fault in the train coming from Edinburgh! Even worse, we have been told that we can claim a full refund of the fare paid given that I had acceded 60 minutes but we I tried the Lumo website says it is non-refundable! I will never ever book on Lumo again and don’t recommend this company to fellow passengers.

items.title: I'm really happy with Lumo.
items.review_text:
I'm really happy with Lumo.

I've had great experiences on their trains, including the most cheery train driver ever doing the announcements, and the trains have always been fairly quiet so there's not been any issue with crowding.

Most recently I had to cancel a train journey for personal reasons, compounded by the train strikes, and after asking for a refund I was given credit for another journey.  This wasn't useful to me so I emailed Lumo and was contacted by a lovely chap called Ryan who sorted me out with a refund via cheque.  It was super simple and communication didn't take too long despite it being the festive period.

I'll gladly keep using Lumo when I'm able to travel in 2023.

items.title: Seriously good train travel
items.review_text: Seriously good train travel, fast, on time, flexible, comfortable seats, very clean, pleasant helpful and happy train crew, so much better than LNER and they stop at Morpeth too. Absolutely brilliant.

items.title: Don't hate on Geoff Marshall!
items.review_text:
After reading some of the reviews I actually find it hard to believe Lumo have such a bad reputation.

Travelled with Lumo recently and their trains are lightyears ahead of the likes of LNER and GC who go from the North East to London also. Seats are far more comfortable than LNER and the small touches like movies on demand are a great addition!

I may be lucky in that I've never had any delays or cancellations with Lumo but if I do have a choice of them or LNER. I always choose Lumo!

items.title: The worst train experience ever
items.review_text: The worst train experience ever, the seats are so uncomfortable, train was packed and dirty. Trains both ways were delayed by a huge amount causing us a huge inconvenience, Did they offer us a free drink when you are boiling on a packed train? Nope! It is supposed to be automatically updated for compensation so you don't need to reply.. is it heck?! We filled the form in, heard nothing, constantly chased on social media and no help, emailed customer experience no reply. Just a disgusting company, I am going to complain to the Ombudsman

items.title: Cheats that won't pay a refund
items.review_text:
I have tried twice to claim a refund for a journey which falls on the same day as industrial action later this month.

The claims keep being rejected, but on the basis of details which I have not included within my claim, like "the ticket was used for travel" (how is that possible when this is an advanced ticket for May 31st). Crooks

items.title: Nowhere near enough luggage space and…
items.review_text: Nowhere near enough luggage space and staff not very helpful! Edinburgh to Newcastle and back - won’t use this service again. You really need to improve the luggage space I had to sit in one carriage but find an over head luggage space in a separate carriage - and had to move peoples cases about - whilst the staff just said you’ll need to rearrange the luggage!!! Ridiculous!

items.title: Beware luggage policy
items.review_text:
Beware luggage policy
No golf clubs allowed!
Difficult to leave them behind when travelling home from hundreds of miles away!
Ended up paying excess baggage that meant lumo actually more expensive for a budget travel experience

items.title: Filthy train.
items.review_text:
Filthy train.
My seat was covered in food crumbs and when I opened the tray table there was a used tissue waiting.
Disgusting experience

items.title: No storage for luggage
items.review_text: Travelled from Newcastle to Kings Cross on 19th Dec. Absolutely NO space for my 1 luggage case. Had to carry this heavy case up and down looking for somewhere. I am not a young strong person - very stressful experience. Eventually it had to go onto a spare seat causing problems for the person sitting next to it. ONLY use this service if you have NO luggage or something you can put on your knee. Profits before customer needs - to provide a service for travellers without luggage storage makes it 'not fit......'. Will use LNER in the future.

items.title: They split families across multiple…
items.review_text: They split families across multiple seats and 3 carriages. We have young children who were expected to sit by themselves. My youngest son has Down’s syndrome and we had to negotiate with other passengers just so one of us could sit with him. No help from the staff. My other son and I were in different carriages. Terrible!

items.title: Accidentally booked a train with the…
items.review_text:
Accidentally booked a train with the seemingly new train operator Lumo on Trainline.

How a train operator like this is allowed to operate in the U.K. is beyond me.
This is RyanAir of train journeys, and they’re not cheap either.

You’re barely allowed to bring any luggage. On the train!!! 
They have strict luggage allowance  for a tiny bag, airport style measurements, and that’s not very clear when you’re booking the train tickets. This is due to them having taken the luggage racks out to put seats in them instead.
There are no open returns, you have to travel on specific trains and sit in your designated seat, airport style.
It wouldn’t surprise me if their long term plan is to start charging for bags and seat changes, just like Ryan air. 
Lumo makes a mockery of train travelling and is an absolute disgrace that shouldn’t be allowed to exist.

items.title: Poor service ,
items.review_text:
Poor service ,
Train ticket inspector rude,
Poorly organised service, 
Food must be ordered 4 hours before you get on the train, no trolley service between Edinburgh and Newcastle 
Chaotic boarding will not be using lumò ever again

items.title: Seems impossible to get a refund
items.review_text: Requested a refund owing to strikes. Told today that claim is unsuccessful because "refund applications must be received within 28 days of ticket expiry". The date of travel was 22nd December. Today is 18th January and the application was sent several days ago. In what way can this be deemed not to be within 28 days?

items.title: Horrendous online experience
items.review_text: Horrendous online experience! booked for London on 5th Jan 23 which is a non strike day inbetween strikes either side. Received an email saying it was cancelled- no explanation - so i tweeted them (no phone no or proper email addr on website) to be told this email was 'an error' and the train is still on. asked for a follow up email to confirm - no response. have sent around 10-15 messages to them and they keep changing their story, emails have a 28 day response time. eventually gave up and have requested a refund which again takes 28 days - wont use again. Wish I'd read reviews first!

items.title: Walk, drive, fly or cycle BUT DON’T catch this train
items.review_text: The staff are rude, the seats uncomfortable, the train is smelly, the tray tables all broken and constantly fall on your knees.  Half of the seats face backwards and you can’t go forwards. Despite booking 3 months in advance, and specifically picking seats,  I was left sitting backwards in a broken seat with no window.  Horrible and uncomfortable experience.  Never again.  Was planning on catching more trains in the UK, but will not be now.  Have just spent 5 weeks catching trains in Germany, Greece and Italy - all very successfully.  This is a massive disappointment and real turn off.  Also much much more expensive than other trains.  It’s not a cheap option at all.  I would very seriously recommend you do not use this train.

items.title: Avoid at all costs
items.review_text:
I bought an open return train ticket on Trainline, unwittingly on a Lumo train. I’d not heard of the company before. Didn’t realise until after I’d bought it that the open return could only be used on Lumo trains which only run every couple of hours. On the return journey I got to the station in plenty of time only to find out the train was reserved seats only. As was the next. So I’d have to wait 5 hours to get the first available train. Ended up having to spend £50ish to buy a separate ticket with LNER. I wasn’t impressed by the initial journey anyway - very limited luggage allowance, delayed train, staff attitude felt like we were being treated like cattle.

After this experience, and reading the reviews on here, I will be careful to avoid Lumo trains in the future.

items.title: 2nd time on Lumo and 2nd awful…
items.review_text:
2nd time on Lumo and 2nd awful experience. Why is it anything branded low cost attracts self entitled clientele with large amounts of baggage meaning you can't get to your seat!
LNER is pretty much the same cost and a far superior service!

items.title: Very poor
items.review_text:
Tickets were £10 less than the LNER service (Edinburgh to London), but it was a far, far worse experience. They don't provide nearly enough luggage space - staff mentioned a luggage allowance to customers who complained, but I can't say I received any communication about that policy.

The train was delayed, which wasn't Lumo's fault, but their delay repay service doesn't appear to work on mobiles, which makes it pretty useless.

items.title: Only if having to save money
items.review_text:
I understand that there can be some super-cheap fares on Lumo. If you're desperate to save money, then this is OK but the compromise on comfort is too much for me.
- ridiculously under-resourced for luggage storage (had to sit clutching my bag for the first hour or so)
- uncomfy seats. A six foot man and a 5 foot woman don't have the same requirements so moulded seats don't work. I had serious backache by the end of the journey
- pre-booking food? Only if you want chocolate or beer. No sandwiches available from Edinburgh
- VERY busy so no room and noisy
If you do use them, tip is to be early as luggage racks fill up quickly; travel very light; bring your own food and drink

items.title: The WORST company I have ever travelled…
items.review_text: The WORST company I have ever travelled with.Four different stories from staff why it was over 2hrs late.One was toilet was getting repaired/cleaned at depot.Making every excuse not to give me a refund. Staff at King's Cross very unhelpful plus train to Edinburgh my seats double booked everyone crammed in people and cases everywhere piled against doors Staff again very poor. Was told I should have checked twitter for updates. Like me not everyone has twitter. DO NOT TRAVEL WITH THIS COMPANY AND I AM REPORTING THEM TO TRAIN OMNIBUS

items.title: 92 seats in one coach, one stuff member for the entire train
items.review_text:
92 seats in one coach, someone  probably calculated that will save probably extra 3% if they push more people into one coach rather than adding an extra coach to the train.  you start to feel the same bad as on a crowded cheap flight with rynair. Parts of the train are so low that I needed to bend otherwise would hit the ceiling with my head. I could not keep my legs in a healthy position.
I am taller than an average brit but not super tall. 
All this space optimisation focusing only one one criteria (money) leads to forgetting about basic comfort levels.
It is discrimination to optimise for the most average and ignore minority.
This will be legal case at some point which hopefully will stop the eyefolded space optimisation that forgets about the fact that the service is for people with access to human rights.
Ah - forgot to mention - one staff member serve probably  500-1000 people. This should be illegal.

items.title: Do NOT book tickets with this company!
items.review_text: Do NOT book tickets with this company!. My train to Edinburgh was delayed an hour (not a big problem). The staff on the train told all customers that if we had booked tickets with Lumo we would be automatically compensated. Two months later I hadn't heard anything so I emailed. I was told because I did no opt in for auto refunds (no idea where that option was) and I was applying more than 28 days after travelling, I would not get compensation.

items.title: At your own risk of not getting to your destination
items.review_text: Lumo cancelled the booked train a few hours before departure and the advice from them was not to travel (which was not possible for us as we had  committed spend for the weekend). They would not arrange other routes (such as with different operators that had trains running) . We had to book with another train operator last minute, which was higher as it had to be purchased last minute,unlikely to have the cost difference covered.

items.title: Thank you to Lumo Trains and it’s…
items.review_text: Thank you to Lumo Trains and it’s amazing staff! I stupidly managed to board the wrong train at Newcastle intending to go to Durham however due to my own fault I ended up on a train to London Kings Cross with no stops. I was confused, worried and stressed but thankfully the staff put me at ease and helped me get home. I can’t thank them enough for how helpful and fast acting they’ve been. All of the staff had been extremely helpful but I’d like to say a special thank you to the woman who went out of her way to find and supply me with as much information as possible ( I unfortunately didn’t get her name however she had brown bobbed hair on the roughly 15:00 Newcastle to London service stopping only at Stevenage )

items.title: Very poor service
items.review_text: Hi, I was travelling on the 11.23am Lumo train from Edinburgh Waverely Station to King's Cross, found my seat (Carriage A Seat 17.  The seat next to me was soaking wet and stunk!!!  I spoke to a member of staff who said move to another seat.  I did this, but found the seat (Carriage A seat 4) to be very cold, so a 4hr plus journey was very unpleasant, plus I was now unable to sit near my family which I had booked.   I then found out that there was no buffet car and the trolley service promised never materialised. Will not be travelling on a Lumo train again.

items.title: Train journey over 2HRS late.
items.review_text:
Train journey over 2HRS late.
To try & contact a real person!!!!!!!!!
FORGET IT, NO CHANCE.
Online refund form keeps closing. Phone typically on hold.
Diabolical & go round houses to try & find point of contact.
Email they aim to respond in 20 days!!!! USELESS

items.title: Lumo nescent Lumo!
items.review_text: I don't get the negative reviews. I have travelled 4 times on Lumo and the experience was absolutely brilliant every time. Beautiful bright blue trains and staff uniforms. Engaging, proactive, friendly and humorous employees. Think Ant and Dec with a trolley. Staff who showed passengers to seats and stored luggage for them, driver who introduced himself by name, and gave updates on the journey. No overcrowding as they only let people board with pre booked seats. Once there was a delay en route, but the train caught up and we arrived on time. Smooth comfortable warm and speedy journey. Trolley service (like on a plane) was fine... though most people brought their own food. Best of all, non-stop to Newcastle, and then a few more minutes to arrive at our beautiful Morpeth station. I seriously wonder if all the poor reviews are genuine, seeing how the service is in competition with the major provider on the route!

items.title: Smelly dog.
items.review_text:
On time train with good leg room and very nice on board team.
The bad news is a passenger has brought a dog on board and it stinks bringing on my dog allergy. 
Potentially a good rail company but they need a policy for on board animals.
Newcastle departure for Edinburgh 08:42 on 31st October 2022.

items.title: Like Ryanair except one toilet is used…
items.review_text:
Like Ryanair except one toilet is used for luggage storage and the other is swimming in urine with no paper.  The constant pointless shouty announcements add to the joy.

Oh, and an hour late for no clear reason.

items.title: Utilitarian but nice staff
items.review_text: Took Lumo from Edinburgh to London for the first time after making the journey with LNER many times in the past. Can safely say that Lumo seats are by far the more uncomfortable of the two to travel in and really not suitable for a 4+ hour journey. Saying that, all staff were pleasant as they passed through the train.

items.title: Travelled Stevenage to Edinburgh 11th…
items.review_text: Travelled Stevenage to Edinburgh 11th November and returned 14th. Outward train significantly late, absolutely packed and ridiculously overheated. Very uncomfortable. Return journey left on time but delayed on approach to Stevenage- probably not Lumo's fault. Train again jam-packed and sitting at a table very uncomfortable. Unlikely to use Lumo again.

items.title: Misleading the customers
items.review_text: Very misleading that their website said “bike space is first come first serve” when I was looking into reserving space for my bicycle. But train managers said “no bikes are allowed” once I was at the platform. They are playing fast and loose with people’s travel plans. Also their website said “403 Forbidden” when I wanted to raise a complaint.

items.title: It's a regular service with everything you really need
items.review_text:
Lots of negative reviews here, but my I'm gonna tell it how it is.
It's a busy service from London, partly because it's direct to the north and attracts the tourist element with larger luggage requirements.
Seats are fine, toilets are clean at the start of the journey north, not so good at the end of the journey.
Plenty of drink options, but you will wait for the service to start.
Never had a problem with the staff, altho they do tend to be on the younger side of 30.
Probably used the London to ncl service well over a dozen times. Never late so far.
Don't moan about rail travel until you've been to India.

items.title: Travelled London to Edinburgh on 16…
items.review_text: Travelled London to Edinburgh on 16 June and return journey on 20 June. A trolley service of drinks is on board but the staff also check tickets. Checking tickets takes priority. On the outward journey the trolley only made it halfway through the train, and likewise on the return. The staff wouldn’t sell drinks unless you were seated. This meant a 4.5 hour journey each way without a drink. First and last time on Lumo.

items.title: Certainly won’t be back on this…
items.review_text:
Certainly won’t be back on this horrible train ever. Our luggage did not get a space to be kept and the staff did not care about this despite been told. We also were allocated a very horrible seat which they refuse to change for us. The most annoying thing was that she told us she was going to check for one but she never returned. 
On our way to Newcastle we complained to them about our return seat and they asked us to complain at their office in Newcastle, on getting to Newcastle they don’t have a office there. Why would you direct us to a place you know you don’t have staff and office at. Avoid them as much as possible

items.title: Great experience.
items.review_text:
We traveled from London Kings Cross to Edinburgh on the 11.19 Lumo train. 
The journey was faultless. 
We left in time, the seats were very comfortable, the cabin was clean,  the snack trolley was well stocked and the staff were amazing. 
We will definitely recommend Lumo. The company ethics are great too.

items.title: Fantastic service
items.review_text:
I travel once a week on Lumo and I love it.
The two staff on each train work exceptionally hard to service everyone and are always amazingly pleasant and cheerful and funny.
I find the prices very low and it annoys me when others have a go about baggage restrictions. They are not a removal service and if everyone took a bicycle and golf clubs nobody would be able to sit. I take one big bag and it is never a problem 
They are always on time, non stop Newcastle London and don’t go on strike.
The staff have got to know me and chat to me each journey.
I think calling them the Ryanair of the railways is a compliment!!!!!

If you want first class service and all the trimmings then pay the vast price on another network. You still wouldn’t get the cheerful staff though on another service.
I hope they stay around forever.
I’ve never come across any staff member less than cheerful and helpful.
I’ll always use them

items.title: Excellent Edinburgh London service
items.review_text: Excellent Edinburgh London service - on time , efficient and very good value for money. Traveling during the peak festive period, the trains were busy but everyone got a seat and the staff were very helpful with all the luggage. Highly recommend

items.title: No buffet car
items.review_text: No buffet car.   Problems with tickets.  Aggressive and unhelpful staff.  Rude to tourists who don’t speak English.   They need to work out how to serve drinks and snacks.   Nothing in the first hour as the staff focus on hassling people about tickets.    Still waiting.

items.title: Giving it 2 stars for being on time
items.review_text: Giving it 2 stars for being on time. These trains have no space for luggage, one plug per two seats, and I am shocked by how dirty the train is. Seats aren't cleaned, floor is extremely dirty. I'll not be using them again  unless there is no other option.

items.title: Rowdy group of eight 30 somethings made…
items.review_text: Rowdy group of eight 30 somethings made a 4 hour trip from Edinburgh a nightmare. Conductor did not attempt to intervene and most passengers too timid to complain. Not a quiet carriage but a riot carriage

items.title: No refund
items.review_text: Have just discovered I can get no refund for a fixed ticket even though I was advised by Lumo that they could not run the service due to maintenance work at Newcastle. It is almost impossible to contact them. Claiming a refund is a nightmare. I have been given an evoucher which is no use to 83yr old pensioner. This is just one of these cheap internet companies with no support. LNER was £2.00 more. Comfortable, on time and obliging.

items.title: Surprised to read the negative reviews…
items.review_text: Surprised to read the negative reviews on this site as I've just had a perfectly OK journey with Lumo. Wi fi was a bit patchy but everything else fine and very cheerful, helpful staff.

items.title: You get what you pay for on Lumo.
items.review_text:
You get what you pay for on Lumo
The fares good and the trains are 99% the same as LNER so if you travel LNER standard class youll be fine on Lumo,both use class 800s. 
Seats are fine and the leg room is really good but like I say you get what you pay for in the sense of there's alot of people who use the train to travel from Edinburgh to Newcastle because its cheap for days out drinking. This means alot of groups play loud music, drink and are generally loud. I totally want them to have a good time but when Lumo is one of the cheapest choices and a lot of families travel with them it could make there journey unpleasant. This has happened on about 3 occasions on Lumo when I've travelled mainly weekends so it seems to be a common occurance.

items.title: Uncomfortable journey
items.review_text: This service is intended for long journeys between London and Edinburgh buts it cramped, uncomfortable and nowhere near enough luggage space. Poor WiFi too. A very long 4 and a half hours.

items.title: Trains don’t arrive & refunds not processed
items.review_text: The train never showed. When submitting refund info, they replied noting the ticket was cutoff. As a Canadian traveller, do not book your train with them. Go with any other rail company.

items.title: Pathetic excuse for service provider!!
items.review_text:
Two journeys cancelled on two consecutive days as the only service cancelled on the day (all other trains, from other providers have run). 
No explanation, no suitable warning, be aware and avoid this pathetic bunch of cowboys!!

items.title: Trying to get a refund for strike-hit…
items.review_text: Trying to get a refund for strike-hit journeys is an absolutely dreadful experience. In the end I gave up. The company requires so much unnecessary information [what for?] and the site is so complicated that it it takes the brains of Einstein to work-out what is required. In contrast, LNER's refunds procedure is simple, clear and reliable.

items.title: Surprised at the reviews on here as I…
items.review_text: Surprised at the reviews on here as I travelled from Newcastle to King's Cross without a hitch. Very helpful crew and buffet service was a nice surprise and very reasonable. Do not believe everything you read, people are quick to complain...

items.title: Awful!!
items.review_text: Awful!!! I came up to Newcastle for the weekend. My train was cancelled and I was advised not to travel so stayed up another day. The lumo train the next day was fully booked and I could not get on. So I had to spent £50 on a new ticket for another better company. I will not be using lumo again. This is my second time with them and last time a carriage flooded and was delayed. Awful company and massive scam. Cannot even get a refund even with insurance.

items.title: After enduring a terrible journey from…
items.review_text: After enduring a terrible journey from Kings X to Edinburgh on a Lumo train that was overcrowded and with very cramped seating, my journey back was even worse. Firstly as I got on the train I overheard one poor passenger being harangued by lumo staff to pay an extra £60 for bringing more than one suitcase on to the train after which the train was cancelled and the only alternative train that lumo tickets were accepted on was via Manchester. Will never take this service again!

items.title: Poor
items.review_text: Seats to bolt upright.  Table on outward journey and return broken.  Can’t believe these trains are relatively new!!  Train announcements sound like Hi de Hi Camper!

items.title: Been on the train two hours now and not…
items.review_text:
Been on the train two hours now and not seen a member of staff in site…. Make sure you bring your own drink on the train as you’ll struggle to get one on board!

Considering I get the NCL - Kings Cross weekly, I’ll now consider the alternative operator

items.title: A con train operator
items.review_text: Refused from a train due to carrying sports equipment, although then told by a ticket officer the train was over booked. Was promised a refund by the ticket conductors who refused me travel although this has never happened. Have been emailing back and forward with very difficult customer service representatives. A con train operator.

items.title: Just don’t
items.review_text:
Just don’t!  We bought tickets on a lumo service, the tickets that were issued weren’t accepted at the barriers, there were no lumo staff around to help, missed the train and can’t use the tickets with any other operator, not an issue if lumo ran frequent services but they don’t.

Follow up, when we called lumo at the time they told us to book tickets on the next LNER service and that we claim a refund for the Lumo tickets; Lumo emailed me 2 weeks after the claim after requesting proof of replacement tickets etc and told me they won’t be issuing a refund and that i was welcome to contact national rail.  Terrible service and they’re dishonest!

items.title: My train was stopped due to problems…
items.review_text:
My train was stopped due to problems with the over head line.  I was stranded in Howwood for over 2hrs whilst my wife drove to get myself and 2 year old son. 
I’ve tried twice now to get a refund and both times declined.  I’ve pictured my ticket.  Screenshot my conversation with my wife on WhatsApp which showed my current location and time.  
Still they deny the train was cancelled.  Must of been easily 500 people stranded on the train.  

Absolutely s**t.  Keep the £17.  I’ll not be using this company again.  Bunch of robbers.

items.title: REMOVE THIS COMPANIES FRANCHISE How on earth is the government allowing…
items.review_text:
How on earth is the government allowing a company like this to operate & getting tax payers money for the privilege !!! I agree with a previous review that suggests they may not be working within the legitimate guidelines. Having several members of my family in the rail industry & my sister a previous very senior manager of a rail franchise I will definitely be looking into this company . 
My daughter , her husband & 10 month old baby stranded in Edinburgh Station due to MISLEADING , unclear information on Lumo’s website !!! My son in law paid extra to have an open ticket because of the baby . This unfortunately with such an awful train company works against you . NOTHING is clear !!!

items.title: We were traveling from Edinburgh to…
items.review_text: We were traveling from Edinburgh to London on December 10 at 11:00. The train was late. Later we were to change buses in Gratham. We waited for 3 hours to be told at 6:30 p.m. that the train would go to London. We were late getting to the hotel. We demand a refund but the company has been ignoring us for 1.5 months. We don't know what to do with it

items.title: Great journey
items.review_text: Comfortable seats with lots of leg room. Free wifi that worked, also free movies to watch throughout the journey. The staff were really friendly, and the driver kept everyone up to date with travel info and arrival time. I will actively choose this service in future.

items.title: The 5* reviews are clearly fake and put…
items.review_text:
The recent 5* reviews are clearly fake and put on by LUMO to try and boost their rating as nobody would write the following if putting on a genuine review:

 'We only brought one suitcase each (as permitted by the Lumo website), and have nothing to whinge about.
We are currently travelling north, train is on time….
Understand it is fully electric….another positive'

or

'Moral of the story. From now on I’ll book with Lumo. Just in case the other operators decide to strike a few days before. They’re a great company with a simple ethos.

Finally, for those complaining about luggage. It’s clear as day when you book on their website what their luggage policy is. If Trainline are not showing it; that’s their issue. Lumo can only offer cheaper tickets if it maintains certain criteria. (Imagine booking Ryanair and expecting the luggage allowance of Emirates). Check it before you travel, and you’ll have a drama free journey.'


These reviews are so clearly put on by LUMO to justify their incompetence. This operator would struggle to run a bath, never mind a rail company. How about improving your service to boost your rating rather than posting fake reviews?

Its well worth checking their equally bad reviews on Facebook!

items.title: Horrendous: The Ryanair of trains
items.review_text: The Ryanair of trains. Horrific service , aggressive about baggage allowance, staff literally shouting at passengers. Quite honestly never known a train service like it. Terrible avoid and spend the extra 10 pounds for LNER !

items.title: If I could give zero stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give zero stars I would. Over an hour before my train was due, it was stated the train was delayed with no reasoning. As time got nearer there were still no update regarding platform or where the train was, so I was left in the dark. I ended up waiting another 15 minutes after my train was due to have left Edinburgh station but then had no choice but to buy a brand new ticket for another service as I needed to catch a train in order to get on my connecting train later on that day. I am still yet to hear about a refund for a train that showed up over 2 hours late and was cancelled for the destination in which it was set for. Unbelievably unreliable and unhelpful. Will not be relying on lumo again and I recommend you don’t either.

items.title: The most hideous and unprofessional service
items.review_text:
The most hideous and unprofessional train service.
We travelled from Edinburgh to Kings X. Unfortunately a fatality on the line earlier mean that many services on the line had been cancelled earlier resulting in hundreds of people pushing onto the train at Newcastle. Total chaos and the staff had no idea how to deal with it. Police were actually called to deal with unruly passengers.
The end result was people standing for the rest of the journey (3 hrs) squashing against us in our seat. Daughter was in hit the face with a back pack and I had passengers being abusive to me when all I wanted to do was go to the toilet. No running water in toilet either. My daughter also has anxiety and the situation caused us a lot of unnecessary stress.
I complained and the response is unacceptable, pretty much, well yi6u were lucky, you had a.seat.
They were no cheaper than other providers, just a slightly better time on the day of travel.
DO NOT RECOMMEND

items.title: Passable journey, disappointing and opaque luggage restrictions…
items.review_text:
I travelled from Edinburgh to London King’s Cross yesterday. The journey was 30 minutes delayed, but otherwise uneventful. The train itself was fine, not as pleasant as an LNER or similar long-distance service, but passable enough. 

My main complaints are twofold- firstly, that the refreshments trolley does not sell any sandwiches or hot food, meaning passengers must bring this with them. Secondly, the luggage policy and storage arrangements are ridiculous. I have long thought that there is not enough luggage space on British trains and Lumo have somehow managed to worsen this. This is just not acceptable for a train operating company- the public should be encouraged to use rail travel over air travel, and part of that includes not having restrictions on what passengers can bring. Several reviewers here have said they would rather fly to Edinburgh next time, which is concerning given the amount of emissions generated for such a short journey by air when compared to the rail journey. It is particularly sad given that Lumo make much of their trains being electric. 

Lumo: rethink your luggage policy urgently. If you are driving passengers back to the airlines, then being fully electric is naught but greenwashing. Oh and please add sandwiches to your catering carts, thanks.

items.title: No food, no WIFI for £100 journey
items.review_text: After paying £100 for a ticket from London to Edinburgh you expect to use the food and beverage service on the early morning train at least. There has still been no food/drinks service 2 hours into a 4 and a half hour train journey with no announcement or explanation why. I didn’t have time to stop by for food before and I am starving! Also, for a £100 ticket you expect to at least have a window/isle seat with a view. I got a seat in a completely blocked off area with no outside view. Also the WIFI does not work at all, I booked the Monday morning train so I could get some work done and it’s impossible. LNER is way better and if I will leave horrendous amounts of train journey money again on this route it will be to them. Totally unexceptable.

items.title: Absolutely appalling to get a refund…
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling to get a refund from, to the point it is though they make it is a difficult as possible or strive to not refund.  Wouldn't travel with them again.  Service Cancelled due to weather and they won't honour refund.

items.title: Would recommend and also would use again
items.review_text:
Had a very straight forward, quick, good value trip from Kings cross to Edinburgh on LUMO.

On the way back we were with LNER so I write this having been able to compare them against a line operator who does not position themselves as low-cost.

The Lumo train has fewer carriages (5 i think), and it was 95% full all journey but did not feel crowded. There was plenty of leg room, everyone could get their bags stowed either overhead or in the compartments at each end of the carriages. Chairs had individual lighting, a pull out table and wing head rests. The chairs were tall which meant you did not feel you were in a crowded space. The journey was very smooth, very quick and quiet. The inside of the train was clean and nothing looked torn or tatty.

Staff were very friendly and the announcements were very clear over the tannoy without being bombarded every few minutes like on some operators.

On board food and snacks are limited but there's plenty of choice in the station to stock up on before hand. 

Wifi was pretty useless, I could not load anything despite my device saying it was connected but that feels like a first world problem.

Overall I would definitely travel Lumo again, and actually preferred it compared to the other operator's service we used.

items.title: No food onboard
items.review_text:
Booked months in advance for 2 adultes and 1 child  and given preferences as requested to seat together and facing forward.  Non of that happened. 
So apparently you are meant to preorder food… would have been great to receive an email to let you be aware of that as no sandwiched are again Le to purchase on the trolley.. I actually were told that if you book through lumo you do get an email. We booked through ScotRail .. didn’t know they was racism between rail companies and that when you book through another supplier you don’t get the same service… maybe we should have packed some food but we kinda like the experience of buying on board. Ended up not eating and a child just with crisps … poor poor poor… been told that for next time I would need to preorder. Well there won’t be a next time.

items.title: This company should be avoided
items.review_text:
This company should be avoided. I took one of their trains unwittingly between London Kings Cross and Edinburgh on 31/08/22. They casually stopped the train at Newcastle and threw all passengers off because another of their trains had broken down and they “needed to return this working one to London”. When I tried to board the next LNER train from Newcastle to Edinburgh, a loud and very clear announcement was made by the LNER guard that “no Lumo will be accepted” and a £60+ charge will be levied on anyone wishing to buy a new ticket to Edinburgh. Instead, we are told to wait an hour for a Cross Country service - which will likely have standing room only.
It is pitiful that these train companies serving the identical route are not better joined-up to serve passengers. I am a regular traveller on this route and will avoid the amateur operators at Lumo from now on.

items.title: Cancelled trains / late trains / delay repay 28 days
items.review_text: Cancelled trains, late trains, 28 days for delay repay. Being passed between LNER and Lumo for refunds etc, neither admitting responsibility. Shambles to say the least.

items.title: Use another train company.
items.review_text: Firstly if you are reading this I would STOP all relationship with this company. They have no idea what customer service is. I booked a ticked from London to Edingburgh 10th December. Return on the 15th Deecmber. Lumo cancelled the return and gave no explanation at the time. I have had to fight to get a refund, in which they will only refund partial. Weirdly I got a email from Lumo stating that if I was one of the unlucky customers to have their journeys cancelled this was an IT issue. They highlight it was not my fault but will not refund the cost.

items.title: Merry'bloody'Xmas

The dates on your website for a refund only go till the end of December 22 so not even possible to request a refund. Happy New Year to you from everybody on the cancelled 17.47 from Newcastle to London. What a shambles of a company you are turning out to be.

items.title: Absolutely digusted with what occurred
items.review_text: Absolutely digusted with what occurred. First time travellor from SA where i was intially ignored when requesting assistance with which train to board and then put onto the incorrect train after showing my ticket to the lumo staff, only to be told while the train was moving that i was on the wrong train and now had to buy a ticket (for 3 adults) at 186 pounda where my initial tickets only cost 32pounds. The staff saw my ticket and told me to 'get in the train' intitially and then denied it and insisted that i had to buy tickets. The lady assisting was rude, abrupt and seemed disinterested in assisting me even though i askedfor help before boarding which was ignored. Will never use lumo again ans advise all my friends in Sa of this nightmare experience

items.title: Train cancelled, I was stuck in Edinburgh with no other trains, and it took a lot of pestering and admin for Lumo to give me my money back. Worst train company ever.
items.review_text:
My train from Edinburgh to London was cancelled completely (due to a broken windscreen wiper). It was the last train that day (at 5:55pm). Lumo staff kept us waiting for 1 hour on the platform before telling us what was happening and what our options were (causing customers going to Newcastle to miss an alternative train). I had to stay in Edinburgh for an extra night and travel the following day. I have tried to claim my train ticket cost back via their website (which is a pain becuase the automation does not work and you have to type everything in) and received a reply saying that their is evidence that my ticket was used for travel so my claim is not valid. I used the ticket for travel on a Lumo train the following day, as advised - i.e. a delay of more than 16 hours. I am now having to waste time appealing the decision - this is appalling. 
We were also told by Lumo staff at the station that we would be able to apply for compensation for costs incurred by staying in Edinburgh an extra day - in my case bus tickets to and from the station and a meal (I did not need a hotel as I was staying with a relative). But they are refusing to honour that because they say I have to have receipts, and the bus does not give receipts as it is contactless, and they will not accept a bank statement as it is not "itemised", even though it says Edinburgh buses for the correct time and could not be anything else.
If I could give them -10 I would.

UPDATE: when I complained to Lumo, they said I had used the wrong form on their website to apply for a refund, apparently "delay repay" is if you have used the ticket and "refund for delayed train" is if you haven't used the ticket, but this is as clear as mud. I got the refund in the end, having wasted time. They also eventually agreed to accept my bank statement instead of a receipt for the bus tickets (which don't exist, of course, as the bus payments are now contactless) for the wasted journey to the station. So I'm giving them an extra star.
I forgot to say that the wifi was also useless, they make you give all your personal details to create an account to get it, and then it can only be used for a very limited number of websites and activities, very slowly!

items.title: Very bad service
items.review_text: Very bad service, tray missing from chair on a 5.30 hr journey for a disable person, staff unprofessional. Costumer service trained to not give refund, will never recommend this train

items.title: dire food and sustenance situation
items.review_text: no cafe, has a trolley service which takes forever to make its way through the carriages. no sandwiches or hot food unless you preorder. what planet do they live on?

items.title: Appalling behaviour of staff
items.review_text: Appalling behaviour of staff. At the last minute of departure I was on the platform and gates were shut in front of me and on top of that the staff gave very bad expressions. Zero respect for passengers. I cant get my money back and that will be used to pay such employees.

items.title: Caught a Lumo train from Kings Cross to…
items.review_text:
I caught a Lumo train from Kings Cross to Edinburgh. I chose Lumo because it was easy to book a seat reservation. It was the first time that I had used this service. Signalling problems at York slowed the train. This was not the fault of Lumo, but even then I arrived in Edinburgh only three minutes late. The return journey left Edinburgh on time and arrived at Kings Cross on time.
It is advisable to abide by the company’s luggage restrictions of one bag that can be stored in the overhead luggage rack and one smaller bag that can be accommodated under the seat or on lap. This is relevant because of the popularity of the service meaning that most, if not all, seats are occupied. I wish other train operating companies were as rigorous. All of the staff that I encountered were friendly and visible. The food available is basic so I would advise passengers to either eat before their journey or purchase sandwiches, etc. from elsewhere beforehand. The seats were a little on the stiff side but were in a comfortable sitting position. I am 6’7” tall and there was adequate leg room for me even with a camera back stored under my legs. I will use Lumo again if I need to travel to Edinburgh again.
