items.title: Do not use this company. Shoddy service and dreadful staff.
items.review_text: We have been supporters and users of LUMO since it was first launched but, after today, never again. The staff on the tain were rude and incredably unhelpful. Also there are major safety issues. They appear to think it is OK to pile lugage rubbish bags to blocks door access and to pile cases unsecured which in the event of a crash or emergency stop would tumble out blocking esacpe routes.  We arrived early to secure a place for a large bag which, because of its contents and the warnings about thefts from luggage on these trains, we wanted to keep under direct observation throughout our journey from Kings X to Newcastle. 3 late arrivals and their very smelly dog rocked up later and then started to rearrange everyone else's bags to suit their requirements. When we refused to move our bag the train staff, who said when asked said her name was Jane (but she held her ID card so that you couldn't check), then joined them in mocking our refusal to comply with a smug grin. She then went on to say that if we had a problem it wasn't her problem as "she hadn't designed the train". so much for customer service. As a partly disabled pensioner I would have expected better. Never going to use them again and will advise everyone I know to avoid them like the plague.

items.title: Avoid by all costs - go for LNER if you can
items.review_text: Not enough space for luggage. Bad and cheap service. We were kicked off the train from Edinburgh to London because there wasn’t enough room for all bags due to the train being too busy for the coronation weekend, they claimed. We had to buy new tickets last minute with another train company. Train staff just said that they also didn’t like that part of their job. I feel for them. Avoid by all costs and go for LNER if you can. Of course they don’t even offer a refund anywhere.

items.title: got an e-mail that my e-voucher (for…
items.review_text: Got an e-mail that my e-voucher (for delay repay claim) is on the way and  NEVER RECIEVED IT.. just a bunch of money feasters,                                                   trying to buy a ticket and can't add my 16-25 railcard?!

items.title: A surprisingly good experience!
items.review_text: Having read numerous poor reviews I was very nervous to be travelling to Edinburgh and back on Lumo for a short break with my two children. I didn’t need to worry, the trains were on time both ways and faultless. I had pre-contacted Lumo to enquire about changing our seats to ones around a table and this was sorted, they were reserved for us both ways. The train was clean, comfy and despite being full with Easter travellers, everyone was very quiet and content. The snack trolley came up and down a few times during the four hours and the staff were regularly through checking on everyone. Toilets were fine, obviously not amazing condition by the end of a long journey used by lots of people but I’ve seen far worse! The only slight negative is the Wi-Fi was very poor (non existent!) along with their own entertainment they promote, very little choice.. 8 films and two were Xmas ones in April! Music only classical etc. so pre-download things and have plenty of data! As long as you read the rules on luggage, the fact there’s no meals, no first class, not changing date etc. then I think you will be just fine. If there’s delays due to rail faults then this would happen on any service, I would definitely use Lumo again!

items.title: Avoid this company.
items.review_text:
When providing the exact specification of the golf bag I was arranging to transport, the agreed price went from £42 to £277, a 650% increase. The cancellation term then threatened is £25 cancellation fee (for a service booked over one month in advance) and 10 days to process the refund.

I don't believe this company legitimately follows consumer standards.

items.title: First timer, and not the last time
items.review_text:
Excellent service. Nice trains, nice seat, nice temperature, on time departure: everything you want from an operator. 

Crew on board were great too. I’m on the 1st Sept service from Edinburgh to London. Due to the strikes, my LNER train ticket got cancelled at the last minute. The next available service where my ticket could be used was well into the following day. But I need to be in London from Saturday morning. Luckily Lumo were there, picking up those left helpless by the last minute strikes. And offering an impeccable service.

Two points to note here:

I’m all for strikes… But with advance notice. Calling a strike a week in advance (when these tickets were booked 2 months in advance) is unacceptable.

Short notice strikes will only lead people away from your company, or to use last minute alternative options if they exist.

Moral of the story. From now on I’ll book with Lumo. Just in case the other operators decide to strike a few days before. They’re a great company with a simple ethos.

Finally, for those complaining about luggage. It’s clear as day when you book on their website what their luggage policy is. If Trainline are not showing it; that’s their issue. Lumo can only offer cheaper tickets if it maintains certain criteria. (Imagine booking Ryanair and expecting the luggage allowance of Emirates). Check it before you travel, and you’ll have a drama free journey.

The lovely people a lumo trains found us seats on the next train!! Hope the weekend is back on track now ! The lumo staff were very understanding and helpful, can't thank them enough. I had a sports bag but also has a small set of golf clubs in a soft carry case. Lumo do not except golf clubs. At no point booking my ticket through the Trainline App does its day this. I was told by a rude member of staff to read the Lumo website. I can understand this policy as I saw the train was clearly overbooked and rammed. The train is like a commuter train - rigid seats and people packed in like sardines and is no way fit for a 4 hour journey. I see no reason why anyone would book with these guys unless it was inadvertently like I did. I hope they don’t allow these sorts of operators to take on more lines.

items.title: Good experience with Lumo although will…
items.review_text: Good experience with Lumo although will say that for passengers who want to get a place for their luggage should reserve and get on the train as soon as possible.

items.title: I booked my tickets through Trainline…
items.review_text:
I booked my tickets through Trainline and whilst I can't complain about the ticket price, these trains are awful if you're traveling with luggage. 

After traveling across France last week, I've accumulated many items and have a large suitcase, and a big bag for life, and now stuck on a train with no where to put my items and unable to sit down, even though I do have a seat booked. 

I have been shouted at by staff, and asked if it's totally necessary to travel with baggage, and whilst for some people it isn't, I do need all the items within my suitcase and bag. 
One member of staff told me to go down to the bottom of my carriage to put the suitcase on the luggage holder, however after explaining to him there was no room on there, he said make room! Another member of staff was friendly and tried to help, however she was flustered in the process as well. 

Surely if a service has that little space between then lumo should provide luggage only carriage for their customers. Even just for customers heading to Edinburgh, therefore other customers could use the luggage racks provided. 

If traveling with a brief case, or rucksack great choice, with have luggage I would recommend paying for LNER OR GRAND CENTRAL.

items.title: Pretty awful!
items.review_text:
Pretty awful! They want your money, and once they have it, they could care less about you. 
No food carriage and the elusive trolley hasn’t been round after 3.5 hours on our 4 hour train journey, so no where to even get water. When we asked the staff they told us they were to busy. Had we have known about the lack of facilities we would have been prepared, but I have never been on a train journey of this length without food and water being available. 
Also, the sink in the toilet seems to have ran out of water, leaving us with soap covered hands and no way to rinse it off. 
Complete lack of storage for luggage, there is all sorts everywhere on the coach. 
Would not travel with this company again.

items.title: Worst experience of my life
items.review_text: Don’t use lumo unless you don’t mind waiting hours and hours or having it cancelled. Waited for hours with a baby and toddler and staff at the station have absolutely no idea or explanation as to why the train hasn’t arrived and everyone saying different things as lumo do not communicate with or update the station so we were left waiting with no idea how long it would take or if the train would show up. Eventually had to leave with a disappointed toddler and distressed baby and we lost a lot of expenses spent on this trip and the whole day and trip had been ruined which is something that no refund could fix.

items.title: Very angry
items.review_text:
Very angry! I just received absolutely appalling service whilst trying to board my pre-booked train...I got refused on my train from Edinburgh to London with my golf clubs. I have never in my life been told i can't take my golf clubs on a train (i am 51 years old) and that includes several journeys on Lumo! I had no other baggage of any significance and the train was not full. The train assistant showed me some t&c's on her mobile where it mentioned no sporting equipment BUT later when i checked my ticket there were NO t&c's mentioning items not allowed. I bought my ticket through Trainline (a popular 3rd party booking app) and there was nothing, both during the buying process (i did a test buying the ticket again to re-assure myself i hadn't missed it the first time) and after looking at my purchased ticket. My missed train has cost me a lot both financially, including having to booking another expensive train, and also missing an important appointment. Surely this can't be right, a company cannot sell a ticket to the consumer without making sure the essential info is CLEARLY stated, especially if they allow a 3rd party app to sell their tickets...there was no statement about prohibited golf clubs  AT ALL!!!

I also saw them bullying some young Asian travellers with normal sized suit cases...a very bad look...shame on Lumo!

items.title: Great Service all round!
items.review_text:
So just to defend Lumo from some previous poor reviews...

1. If you book a Lumo only Anytime ticket, you should really check your ticket before you board, don't get how that's the train operators fault. In the same way you can book an Anytime LNER/GC ticket and get on the wrong train. It's your responsibility to buy the right ticket.
2. It's not 'racism' to book through ScotRail and not hear all the details. It's common knowledge that if you book a train directly with the operator you get more info about your journey.

For myself, every time I have travelled Lumo I have found it a comfortable and efficient service. You are paying for a low cost operator, so you should expect a low thrills experience however I believe Lumo is better than that. For instance, the ability to connect to Wi-Fi and watch films on your phone/tablet while travelling is a godsend in my opinion, especially if you're like me and forget to download things to watch before travelling!

I find the Lumo trains to be a lot more comfortable than the Azumas that LNER offer and with the slight recline that Lumo have compared to the upright ironing board seats that LNER have, I genuinely feel comfortable on Lumo's trains.

One thing I would advise though, if you don't like busy trains, Lumo aren't for you. Their services are always busy but I myself have never felt cramped on them. 

Thankfully I've never experience delays with Lumo (touch wood) so have yet to experience their out of train customer service however their onboard customer service is superb! Always friendly and polite!

items.title: Can't seem to understand refund policies when more than one person travels on the same booking
items.review_text:
We have travelled with this company before and it has been okay. However on our return journey from Edinburgh to London the train was delayed for 74 minutes. This was partly due to their muddle in Edinburgh, failing to get the water topped up and partly due to a broken down train the line, which was not their fault. There is an entitlement to 100% refund if delays arriver an hour. We tried to reclaim for two tickets through their website. They appeared to be unable to understand that we had two tickets and disallowed one claim, saying that we had claimed twice for the same ticket. We appealed this and resent the photograph of the disputed ticket. We have not heard back yet. They also said that they could not refund money to our account and have to send a cheque for the claim they did allow...no idea why....
UPDATE
Eventually refunds for both tickets were agreed. We were told that they could not credit our account and would send a cheque. Email received saying a cheque would be send on 7/9/22 and it would take 10-15 days. It hasn't arrived. We were told the second ticket refund had been approved but have not had a refund. Just complained. Maybe they are just trying to avoid payment....

items.title: LNER service listed on website
items.review_text:

Be careful They LNER trains on their website so you think you can jump on those.. you can’t.  £175 out of pocket 

Trains are noisy uncomfortable.  Tried to go cheap and ended up paying for it. 

Pay a bit more and use the proper train!

items.title: Rudest people they think they’re an airline
items.review_text: I’ve never encountered more rude workers than the people working on this train line

items.title: Pay extra for a different train provider
items.review_text: These trains are not fit for lengthy journeys. Seats are like planks of wood.  Toilet disgusting, WiFi rubbish.  Not enough luggage space.

items.title: Poor communication & Junk marketing
items.review_text:
Trains schedules were impacted by November 2022 rail strikes, and engineering works, but Lumo's inability to provide reasonably up to date information was poor.  The Lumo website said revised schedules for Sunday 6th November would be available by 31st October.  On 5th November the Lumo website still says 31st October.  Due to reduced service any Lumo trains running were mandatory reservations only, but after trying for 2 days to make a seat reservation via their Twitter team I'm not told that the Lumo system is down.  Rubbish communication!

The catering/trolley service never reached Coach A in the 3 hours from London to Newcastle.

The website says Lumo is "A new train service helping you to travel well, beyond expectations".  Not sure if Lumo was intended to be a challenger or disrupter rail service but it doesn't appear to be anything different compared with any other train operator in the UK, actually probably worse than most, including Avanti West Coast.  The Marketing department at Lumo who're pushing the "We're different!!!" message really need to speak with the people who are actually running train services, as the marketing message is far from what's happening in reality.

items.title: Carriage for kids
items.review_text:
The train should have carriage separated for family with small children. The kid cried all the way long.
My ears hurt. So annoying.

items.title: Yesterday from Edinburgh Waverley to…
items.review_text: Yesterday from Edinburgh Waverley to London King’s Cross was a worse experience ever when boarding a Lumo train and being told off rudely by one of the staff that our luggage was too big?  What the hell is this service?  Both my girlfriend and I were unaware of their so called policy what passengers can take or not?  I did not expect to hear of other comments about passengers being told to leave their belongings at the platform!!!  We were very disappointed with Lumo and the way we were treated?  However, we got the impression that the service was behaving similar to airline services charging passengers extra due to size?  I was threatened with a £30 charge, but somehow I was able to put my luggage on a chair where there was no window to view the scenery.  This was in order to getting my case out of the way so passengers could move along.  My girlfriend was sitting where there was no window and kept her case next to where she was seated.  Having saying that and knowing how chaotic it was to finding a luggage space to putting our cases, we came to a conclusion that where there were no windows to view we expect that there might have been luggage spaces and that they might have been removed and inserted new passenger seats to make more room?  I am claustrophobic and did not expect to be sitting next to a wall where I cannot see?  Both of us felt closed in and it was like being put into a wall cupboard.  We put this to Lumo that it was unsatisfactory, bad attitudes from staff and that we will not be travelling with this service again!!!!

items.title: Perfect all round
items.review_text: Used Lumo from Newcastle to Kings Cross. I had booked with them as the price was cheap for a rush hour train compared LNER. Train departed on time and arrived on time. Seat comfortable, staff friendly and polite. Great that there were no stops on the way as well. Would use again.

items.title: Cheap and nasty
items.review_text: Cheap train fair for a reason. Very little leg room absolutely no space for luggage. Staff had to throw luggage into the restroom.

items.title: To their credit… as of 10th Jan 2023
items.review_text:
Another bad review for a disappointing company who still haven’t learnt about running a train operation. 

Second time I’ve been taken for a ride(less). They should let LNER take over the franchise as the 12.50pm Lumo train from Newcastle was delayed and then cancelled due to an on going fault And LNER have a lot more consistently well run trains. I thought Lumo trains were fairly new trains?!? 

I’m now writing this on a very busy, standing room only LNER train and Lumo have lofty ambitions but nil points from me in terms of service and customer satisfaction. The only reason Lumo trains is getting one star is that the train from London to Newcastle was pretty smooth.

I think it’s when trains coming from the north going south they’re not very good at. 

If you travel with these muppets be warned of last second cancellations and delays. Thankfully, I bought my ticket through LNER so will get my delay repay soon enough, instead of jumping through hoops and getting the rail ombudsman involved in my first dispute.

What a bunch of jokers.

Update: 10th January 2023

To Lumo’s credit I will be receiving a delay repay for the original ticket I purchased and as I put in another claim for the LNER ticket I bought and put it in as a delay repay too, Lumo will also be compensating me for that ticket too. Unexpected but better than the first time. Upped it by a couple of stars that they approved and compensated for the time and expense. I just hope they can sort out their trains to be better. Good luck

items.title: I don't have window near my seats…
items.review_text: I don't have window near my seats horrible experience won't travel again with this train

items.title: Worse than a budget airline!
items.review_text: The staff were all very friendly and helpful BUT everything else about the train was below par.  The seats are incredibly cramped, I couldn't even begin to think about using my laptop to work because there simply wasn't the space within the seat to type.  If I had been sitting next to anybody but my husband or a family member it would have been truly awkward as the seats are so close together, far worse than a Ryanair plane!  There was only the option to purchase drinks for a short period of time by going to the top of each carriage, rendered almost impossible due to the cramped conditions and people squeezed into the spaces.  There are constant announcements made in a very officious manner about no luggage to be left out anywhere, the order to remain in your own allocated seat, the requirement to take your own litter away with you etc..  and yet there is hardly anywhere to put luggage.  You are instructed to put smaller bags under the seats but with them being so close together there isn't room for a bag and your feet, I spent the entire 4.5 hour journey twisted into the window (I am 5'10 and my husband is 6'2, we are tall but hardly giants!)  We had purposely booked seats with electric sockets next to them but when we sat down these turned out to just be stickers of sockets, not real sockets - what's the point?   Finally, the air conditioning wasn't working and it was an extremely hot day, we were all extremely grateful to get off in London.  I had heard rumours that Lumo is the worst train service to London from Edinburgh, we usually use Virgin or Avanti, but I thought they were just that, rumours.  Sadly they turned out to be true and we shall most certainly never be travelling by Lumo again.

items.title: First time traveling on lumo train…
items.review_text: First time traveling on lumo train yesterday from Edinburgh to Morpeth,have to say seats so comfortable staff were pleasent too and drink trolley was reasonable

Utter disgusted in this train line very disappointed 😔

items.title: LUMO! Aka Ryanair of Rail (minus cheap fares, just the sullen, combative crew and crazy luggage policies) AVOID at all costs!!
items.review_text: LUMO! Welcome to the Ryanair of train travel (minus the low fares) complete with sullen, untrained, combative onboard staff. Also, daft, unclear baggage policies, and zero understanding/professionalism in dealing with the public/customers, definitely not those with, even really well behaved dogs! I travelled from London to Newcastle today, and, tsk, hadn't read the terms and conditions of LUMO's luggage policy (one item pp, any extra costs £30 per item. A tad miffed as I was, I asked the staff member (Lindsay) to please give me an invoice, but that I wasn't happy, and it wasn't clear. Lindsay didn't like me not being happy about this, and her response was berate me, insisting on the last word, for not reading the terms and conditions. I had my (luckily very gentle, calm) collie dog with me, who I could see was looking anxious that I was upset. I wanted to de-escalate the situation so I could sit down and relax. No chance. Along comes LUMO's second finest crew member, Ben, who tells me to 'stop or I'll have you removed'. Pile-on time. Things eventually calmed down and I began to compose my customer complaint. Dog is bit worried, but then relaxes and lies down in the aisle. Along comes drinks trolley propelled by LUMO's finest, Lindsay and Ben. Before I've had a chance to move my dog Lindsay, true to form, loudly announces 'MOVE YOUR DOG OUT OF THE AISLE'. Dog is scared, refuses to move towards shouty woman and trolley who are right at my seat. I ask them please to move drinks trolley back a bit so I can get dog into my seat (he will come if they back off even a couple of feet). They refuse. Ben announces that if I don't move my dog, he will have no option but to 'call the police'. LUMO's finest sure know how to escalate a situation from zero to 1000 in 2 minutes. Dog ain't moving, he's too spooked. I advise Lindsay that she should probably get some training in dogs on trains and she's lucky he's not, as some dogs would be, barking at her or trying to defend me. Lindsay announces that if my dog was aggressive she'd have it 'put to sleep'. My jaw actually hits the floor at this stage. I pick up the dog from the aisle floor (he's large and this isn't easy) and the trolley sails past us. Thanks LUMO for a truly unforgettable train experience!! I've lodged my complaint for unclear luggage policies and unbelievably rude staff. I can see that customer care training isn't a LUMO priority anyway. I would rather walk to London than ever use this company again, no amount of therapy (for me, or the dog) would ever be enough to be able to cope with such shoddy treatment. God I miss British Rail.

items.title: Customer  service is a joke
items.review_text: Customer  service is a joke ! Strike and not information at all  to support passengers! Are you serious ???

items.title: DO NOT TRAVEL WITH FAMILY
items.review_text:
Extremely poor service with zero consideration for families/babies/children. We were travelling in the evening with our 3 kids under 5, a buggy and bags from Kings X to Edinburgh. Been on this train many times before, always told to sit in the “disabled” area as this is the only area on the train with space for a buggy. We had booked extra seats for our children to sit in - even though they should technically be free. Paid for seats as have known them to be very full, didn’t want to take any chances. We were moved from the disabled area under the pretense that an “autistic girl” needed the seats. Okay, no problem, moved seats. The “autistic girl” that got on was actually a 22 year old woman who was perfectly functional, had totally normal conversation with variety of passengers, travelled with her mother- and seemed to just want the extra space to stretch her legs as she sat on her phone happily. From my experience as a doctor I could safely diagnose she was certainly not autistic to the point of needing this space. 
Then suddenly after 3 hours on this train (it’s now nearly 11pm!!), one of our children asleep in the buggy, the train staff start saying this woman must now move as a wheelchair user needs the space. And I must take my child out of the buggy as it is against their policy to have buggies on the train. I asked what he suggests travelling families do with their buggies. He says if it can be folded small it is allowed on otherwise he suggests not to take the train. RIDICULOUS. I explained this was ludicrous, the train is full, it’s 11PM, I have a sleeping toddler in the buggy, another one asleep on our two seats and our baby asleep on the othet two. He told me I should have purchased more child seats if I needed a space. Menawhile this “autistic girl” occupied 3 seats having only purchased one adult seat. When I pointed this out all he said was “well find a free seat then”. Unbelievable. Even other passengers on the train were coming to support as the interaction was so ludicrous. 
The icing on the cake was that the supposed wheelchair user that joined wasn’t in a wheelchair at all!! Just an older gentleman (in his 60s) and his son with a ton of shopping bags and two suit bags!! Couldn’t believe it. 
To top it off there were two drug addicts who joined as well and insisted on sitting in the carriage claiming they were children (no teeth, no hair, marks all over their arms, smelling of weed and alcohol). The train staff let them sit next to another young family. Laughing about how comical it was. They only asked them to pay for one child seat in the end. 

All whilst I was told to purchase more child seats next time if I wanted my children to be able to sit on the train. Which we had done. Never again. 

No consideration for families at all. Just snide comments and poor staff with appalling communication.

Always difficult with luggage

Awful service

items.title: Zero if I could
items.review_text: Zero if I could. No customer service after numerous emails

items.title: Seating designed by sadists?
items.review_text:
The service was OK, it was on time and the staff were helpful and all, but this has to be the most uncomfortable seating I've ever experienced on public transport. 

And I've flown Ryan Air...

It feels very much like the designers of these carriages set out with a truly machiavellian intent to either cause my posture to resemble that of a road-killed squirrel, or just to cause me irreparable damage on a cellular level.

Quite how one can graduate in seating design, then apparently not only forget every single aspect of it, but intentionally design seating that causes nothing but excruciating pain and discomfort for the entire 5 hour journey, is actually truly an accomplishment. 

The crowning design feature is the tray table, which has the charming habit of smacking down from the upright position directly onto your knees/coffee/now heavily-inflamed groinal area, every time the train goes over a bump bigger than a leaf. And given that the suspension installed was apparently from a 14th Century horse and cart, this happens rather often.

The seats also have the quite wonderful 'closeness' that is becoming unfortunately more common, as each low-budget travel company tries to squeeze just one more, now hideously deformed passenger, onto every journey. 

At precisely 4cm too close to each other, the inspiration appears to have been the 'Little Ease' torture chamber in the Tower of London, a room that was shaped so the occupant could neither stand, kneel, nor sit. 

The task of relaxing becomes like some twisted hybrid of tetris and buckaroo, as you toss in your tiny alloted space, attempting to not have some part of the compartment make sweet, sweet love to a part of your body that really shouldn't be treated that way.

All in all, I think Lumo as a company shouldn't really be blamed in a sense, but I would advise anyone against travelling on one of these trains, unless you fancy shelling out for 6 months of chiropracty and/or major spinal surgery.

There WAS, however, hot water in the toilet. So when they use the jaws of life to extract my limp, crippled corpse from my seat in Edinburgh, at least my mutilated hands will be clean.

items.title: Please avoid this company at all costs

These things happen but trying to claim back compensation for the train we had to arrange to get home has been a nightmare. items.title: Shocking train from kings cross to…
items.review_text:
Shocking train from kings cross to Morpeth cancelled 20 minutes before departure. Travelled on another Lumo train been on 2hrs and no refreshment trolley as of yet.
Never again cheap and nasty to be honest.

items.title: I booked a train from Newcastle to…
items.review_text:
I booked a train from Newcastle to London Kings Cross at 7.57am on 27th June 2022. When I arrived for the train I was advised that the service was cancelled. 
I had to take another train as I was told my ticket was valid. On that train I had to stand all the way from Newcastle to London and because of the state of the line that day the journey took nearly 4 hours. People were standing in the isles. The whole journey (which wasn’t cheap either) was something I will never forget.
Today (28th August) I am still waiting for my refund as per my entitlement. I filled the form out straight away.
This company are a total disgrace and I will not be using them again. Do yourselves a big favour and pay a little more and jump on an LNER train (is my advise) which I have used many times since.
Customer service on LNER is superb.

items.title: Very overpriced and bad service
items.review_text:
Very overpriced and bad service. First time user and the train was delayed on both arrival and return. 
Staff were not helpful throughout the journey and quite rude.
Reservation on seats was a complete mess and people chose to sit where they pleased...did staff help? Of course not!

They rig the arrival time on train apps so unless you have photographic evidence that the train was over 30minutes late, good luck getting compensation back.

items.title: Never again !!
items.review_text:
Our train had a  delayed departure of just over 2 hours to Edinburgh. I claimed compensation and was only awarded  £19.50 instead of full price of both tickets of £76.15 ,as their website states for over 2 hour delay. ( booking  REF:K2JGXR79 )
LUMO DELAY REPAY CLAIM LMO-0723-939-114
After  several attempts at appealing, which closed each time I tried to "review " my appeal, I gave up and called LUMO, being told it hadn't registered. How convenient. The website is a minefield of ways to stop complaints getting anywhere.
I shall never travel with them again, and shall be happier not to as their seats are totally the wrong shape for back comfort and the temperature cooled down to around 55c ,I'd guess at.

items.title: Overpriced and cramped
items.review_text: Overpriced and cramped, smelly trains. Worst train I've ever been on! Paid nearly £300 for the dirtiest, smelly, tiny train! Me and my boyfriend couldn't even put our arms down without squashing each other and we are both slim people! Train seats look like they've never been cleaned since they made the 30 year old looking thing! Ripped and stained with god knows what! Never will I use this awful company again!!!! 😡 Would give minus stars if I could!!!

items.title: Not for me
items.review_text: Not for me.  I’m only 5ft and find the seats cramped.  I’m currently on a journey now on an aisle seat with a big foot stretching out to the side of me.  Clearly the gentleman behind does not have enough space.  I got on at Newcastle and no room left for large cases. It’s a warm day the air con is on but the carriage is quite chilly I’m wearing a jacket in what would be 20 degree heat on the outside.  One member of staff has been around for tickets and one member of staff has tried to put cases on overhead storage that’s all the staff I’ve seen.  Been on the train nearly an hour and half and still no trolley service.  You get what you pay for.

items.title: If I could give Lumo zero stars I would
items.review_text: If I could give Lumo zero stars, I would. Incredibly poor communication and zero thought or consideration of passengers stranded and having to pay extortionate amounts for replacement tickets and overnight accommodation due to last minute cancellations. I will be escalating my complaints. Stay well away from this company.

items.title: Suitcase needed my seat apparently
items.review_text: Nice to have a train direct to Newcastle from London,  lovely clean train apart from people couldn't wheel the suitcases down the isles because it was too narrow and I had been asked to move by staff out of my assigned seat because I had no one next to me an they needed the seats to put large luggage as they had ran out in the designated areas

items.title: Unhelpful train staff caused me to miss my train
items.review_text: Got to the platform with a few minutes to spare before the train was due to depart, was running really late due to train strikes and other personal circumstances so when I got to the platform to see the train had not left I was delighted. Upon getting on the platform the doors started to close - I ran up to the window of the train where a member of staff was asking if she could please open the door as the train had not started to leave. She refused - telling me to stand back. I looked at the time and it was still not time for the train to leave so I could not believe it and begged her to let me on and she did not. The train then left 1 minute earlier than it was scheduled to. I filed a complaint and was told I would not be compensated as trains normally don't let people on 1-2 minutes before - despite this "rule" not being advertised anywhere. Don't say a train is leaving at a certain time when it's not and then blame customers for not getting there on time. Useless service, shall not use again.

items.title: Surprised
items.review_text: I had not travelled by rail for about 20 yrs and if I had read the Lumo reviews I would probably not have travelled with this company from Edinburgh to London Kings X on the 18 Aug 22. Lets get the problems out the road first. I had to go to the buffet to obtain drinks, despite being advised that the buffet trolley would be round. Lumo are following the flow by only accepting plastic for payment ggrrrrrrr. I feel this should be communicated to the passengers every time there is an announcement regarding the buffet bar. The seating is hard on the backside. After 2 hrs it was as if I had ants in my pants. The good points are that the train was clean. the staff helpfull and the train was early on arrival in Kings X. I would agree with others that there is not the greatest of space for large luggage cases, 20 - 26K size. Would I travel again with Lumo?  Yes. The buffet car complaints/ take my own drinks and food, after all it is only a 4-1\2 hr trip. The only thing I cannot change is the hard seating.

items.title: Terrible experience - avoid Lumo
items.review_text: Terrible experience. Bought 2 tickets for wife and self to Edinburgh from London return. Train to Edinbugh on 11/7 terminated at Newcastle. Range of rumoured excuses from tree on line to electricity failure, but no explanations or help given to abandoned passengers. Train back from Edinburgh cancelled due to heat. Totally impossible to get any refunds despite weeks of effort. Avoid this company that does not care about customers.

items.title: On time for once
items.review_text: On time for once but losing the will to live due to the sheer amount of announcements coming over the loud, tinny tannoy about meaningless stuff like whether or not we're stopping in Peterborough (we're not) and whether they'll be taking LNER tickets (they're not).

items.title: Really helpful friendly and hard…
items.review_text: Really helpful friendly and hard working staff went above and beyond for my disabled brother on a very busy train today.

items.title: It was my first time on a Lumo train
items.review_text:
It was my first time on a Lumo train. From Dundee (change at Edinburgh) then on to Kings Cross. They were a good option for those on a budget. I’m glad to see that the big train operators are being subject to more competition. 

The buffet came around twice and the food was affordable and nice. There was also the option to walk to the buffet. I would definitely use Lumo again.

items.title: Tall people can't travel with Lumo
items.review_text:
First time on Lumo, and my last. Here goes:
1) Legroom awful. I'm 6ft 2in and I was unable to pull down my table flat because it hit my knees! Who on earth decided to fit the tables so low??? They aren't as low on LNER (same trains). What an own goal Lumo! So I can't actually travel with Lumo again because its too uncomfortable sitting with both my knees out to one side to enable me to put my coffee on the table. 
2) Toilets looked clean, smelt disgusting! 
3) Not enough luggage space. Clearly prioritising bums on seats over the amount of resulting luggage space required for that number of passengers. 
4) Refreshment trolley only came through twice. Second time there were no hot drinks.
5) Train was dirty when we got on. Food debris on our pull down tables, on seats and floor. Doesn't anyone clean them between trips? Doesn't take long to run through with a small hoover. 
Shocking. I'm staying with LNER (price was about the same).

items.title: Perfrct service.
items.review_text:
We have travelled 6 times with Lumo now between London and Newcastle. Every single experience has been great.
There is very little luggage space but we tend to travel light and staff are really helpful if you need help to find space.
Staff are all friendly, polite and happy. Travelling with kids has been easy and smooth thanks to the ticket reservations being enforced.
We honestly wouldn't travel with anyone else anymore.

items.title: If EasyJet made a train it wouldn't be this crap
items.review_text: Absolute worst train I've been on. It's like they took EasyJets model and thought "how can we make a train that would make EasyJet think we are cheap?"

items.title: Great experience!
items.review_text: Friday 5th August 07:57 from Newcastle to London. The train was clean with plenty of leg room. Although a busy service there was enough room for bags. Train on time. The two lads working on the train were brilliant - my dog got loads of attention. The price is much cheaper than LNER.

items.title: It’s a shame to see all the negative…
items.review_text: It’s a shame to see all the negative reviews. All I can say is that I have thoroughly enjoyed taking the Lumo train to London.  On time arrival and departure. Clean coaches, comfortable seats and good legroom, friendly staff and the price is reasonable and affordable. Have recommended to friends and family. Will definitely use Lumo again. Thank you for a great service :)

items.title: Cancelled train and no help from company
items.review_text: Just got on a train from Edinburgh that's supposed to go to London Kings Cross. But since there was overhead wire damage it terminated at Newcastle. The people travelling beyond Newcastle were not offered the option to use their tickets for other train companies. The only offer was to get a different Lumo train at 6am the next day. So that's extra hotel night that people will be having to pay. No help offered at all. I am luckily travelling to Newcastle but still feel very awful and angry for the people left stranded on the platform.

items.title: could be better
items.review_text:
when i travelled on 22nd june from london to edinburgh, i was allocated a seat with a wall for the northbound journey. for the journey back home towards london, i was actually allocated a seat with a proper window instead of a wall. the train was packed as a result of strike action taking place that week.

would i recommend lumo? probably. just be careful when reserving a seat. you may get a wall like i did

p.s. lumo should do a proper seat plan of their trains which shows people which seats have limited views

items.title: just had such an nice and unexpected…
items.review_text: just had such an nice and unexpected experience on a LUMO train - so unexpected. after the rail strike and being heavily out of pocket and miserable due to forfeited hotel fees and the usual tickets not being universally accepted on alternate trains -  so BIG SHOUT out to the beautiful LEAH staff member on the LUMO 13.50 train from Edinburgh to London. its people like you Leah that make a huge difference to how someone's day unfolds - thank you again, God bless you x
