items.title: TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE
items.review_text:
TERRIBLE TERRIBLE TERRIBLE
We have found out our 6.23 train from Edinburgh to London had been cancelled and Lumo has never updated us, we found out 5.30 in the morning at the train station and now we are going to miss our connecting flight since all the trains are fully booked. Contacted them on Twitter and spoke with Mariel and all he said is I can try and claim my money back only for the trains. They don’t offer any compensation at all. Just stay away. Cheap horrible company and they don’t care about their customers.

items.title: This company is not even worth 1 star
items.review_text:
This company is not even worth 1 star.  
No communication from them whatsoever when our train was cancelled from Edinburgh to London. We travelled 20 miles to Waverley station - only to be told we had to drive to Newcastle !!  There was no LUMO train from Newcastle when we got there so had to purchase LNER tickets for our onward journey. LUMO refuse to compensate us in any way - either for the more expensive tickets we had to purchase - or pay for petrol for 300 miles journey.  Absolutely shocking company - which I will never use again.   The proof of a good company is their communication and how they treat passengers when things go wrong - LUMO have failed in both respects with this.

items.title: Can never speak to a person
items.review_text: I have waiting for a refund and tried contacting the customer services . No phone number that lets me talk to someone, no live chat always off line Wrote an email and no reply. I just needed a simple answer to a simple question. This is what happens with low budget organisations. No person to get help from .

items.title: Great service and wonderful staff
items.review_text:
Fantastic service and wonderful staff. 
I often visit my family in the north of England and always wished there was a more direct service and then my family told me about lumo and I am so pleased they did.
Not only are the fares reasonable but I sometimes get fantastic deals. I used to want to be near the luggage rack because every stop I would be anxious about my suitcase and go check on it but the limited stops on lumo are a dream, straight upto Newcastle! Fantastic. 
There are a few bad reviews for this service but I think it’s brilliant. There is limited luggage space on the carriages which is noted on their website (one medium case per passenger I believe) and it does cause issues. With that said the staff have always been so fantastic and always willing to help reassemble the luggage for a better use of space and like I mentioned there are so few stops that you can sit and feel assured your case won’t be going anywhere.
Back to the staff, they have all been so lovely I can’t stress this enough! I actually missed my train once due to the tube strikes in London and they let me on the next train without any issues. I was ready to put up a fight or get my negotiating face on for the fare difference (I had book far in advance and got a cheap ticket) and I was blown away with their amazing attitude. I really want this company to thrive and not just because they are a Northern company but because they deserve it 😊
Thank you to everyone at Lumo, keep it up!

items.title: Absolutely poor at kings cross station…
items.review_text: Absolutely poor at kings cross station waiting for our 14.48 to Edinburgh cancelled bloody disgusting not even that hot today Wednesday. 20th July. Stuck in London

items.title: Utter shyyyyyte ✋👎👎👎👎👎👎👎
items.review_text: Utter shyyyyyte ✋👎👎👎👎👎👎👎

items.title: Unable to book travel for 3rd…
items.review_text: Unable to book travel for 3rd September. Excuse given is possible engineering work yet LNER have been offering prices for at least 2 weeks now. Have used Lumo a few times before. Will think again next time

items.title: Travelling from Newcastle to stevenage…
items.review_text: Travelling from Newcastle to stevenage on the 12:50, never met such a rude member of staff, the toilets are disgusting, and one of them between carriges is being used as passenger luggage storage, I asked for a cup of which is an instant coffee sachet with an extra shot, £5 she said and I I had an extra spoon of coffee she'd lose her job. God Customer service definitely is lacking here. I travel alot for work and this is the one and only time I'll ever use Lumo trains, LNER everytime now.

items.title: Booked and paid for tickets to go to…
items.review_text:
Booked and paid for tickets to go to London , however on the day of travel , arrived at the station with time to spare , eagerly awaiting the train , the time of departure came and went still no train , checked with the local ticket office to be informed that the train we have reserved was in fact not available on that day .
Came home spoke to Lumo person , to be told it would take 28 days for a refund , however here we are almost  2 months later still no refund despite lots of  emails backwards and forwards 
Would I recommend Lumo - absolutely NOT

items.title: Andy was a star!
items.review_text: Andy, the passenger assistant on my train from London to Edinburgh yesterday (10th of July) at 8.52AM was an absolute star!!! A kind of a young man any parents would be happy for their daughter to bring home! Not only he is a handsome young Northern lad, but a very kind and compassionate one! He deserves a financial bonus!

items.title: Worse experience than the megabus
items.review_text:
Toilets were disgusting, everyone had to use another one in another carriage.

Staff were unpleasant and unfriendly

The seats and aisles are tiny and super uncomfortable

items.title: Great Experience
items.review_text:
Just got back from a return journey on the LUMO service from Newcastle to Edinburgh. It was a very enjoyable trip.

Booked on line via the Northern Rail website and picked up the tickets from the machine at Newcastle station. Easily the cheapest fares on the route. 

The train arrived on time from Kings Cross and indeed all parts of both journeys ran to time. Despite being busy, the train was clean and on the 90 minute journey to Edinburgh rubbish was collected by a member of staff and a drinks trolley served people at their seats.  The train itself is brand new and there is plenty of room between the seats which are better padded and more comfortable than those operated by LNER and Trans Pennine Express. 

Staff were particularly helpful with the driver keeping us updated on progress and the guard/ticket inspector very helpful with a query I had on connections at Edinburgh. She went the extra mile.

Will certainly use the service again.

items.title: Lumo: the choice for those on a tight budget
items.review_text: I used Lumo for the first time yesterday travelling on the 05.45 King’s Cross to Edinburgh. The fare was very reasonable and the website easy to use. There is little difference between LNER Standard and Lumo ie adequate if a little Spartan. The train was heavily reserved but there were a significant number of ‘no shows’ which allowed me to move to one of the rare tables for 4. Even with c.50% occupancy it was clear that luggage storage was inadequate with seats being used for larger items. The trolley had a basic offering with just instant coffee. It is not possible to pre order food on this early departure and the trolley does not have any fresh food such as sandwiches. Staff were pleasant and professional. Fine for the most cost conscious but not the best way to enjoy one of the country’s great train journeys.

items.title: No star
items.review_text: No star, actually. Bought my ticket for 131 pounds with a virtual card (OK, silly me...), realized that I cannot collect it at the station. Contacted customer services who replied twice writing absolutely useless things, suggesting that I rebook. I was so desperate that I even tried that, but the website didn't work. I wrote again to customer services who from this point on simply ignored me. There I was with a large sum paid, no ticket, no email reply, no chat, no telephone number, nothing whatsoever. Finally the very friendly staff at Kings Cross ticket office helped by printing my ticket using the reservation reference. They also said that Lumo is rubbish, which it absolutely is! Incredible, they just take your money and ignore you! Appalling customer services, will never use them ever again! Absolutely NOT recommended.

items.title: Booked open return on a Saturday from…
items.review_text: Booked open return on a Saturday from Edinburgh to Newcastle only to find there were no trains back form 18:00.  Even though the we checked the website and trains were available. Had to buy new tickets.

items.title: Brilliant service
items.review_text:
So sad to read  all the one star reviews for Lumo. I think this service is brilliant and I have no negative words to say about them. I travel regularly with Lumo. They are always on time, really fast and the staff are always friendly and help all they can. My daughter missed her train from Kings Cross due to the underground strike on 6th June. Thinking the worst, that it was going to cost a fortune to get home Lumo  actually let her get on the next scheduled train. I can't think any other train company would have done that. 
Thank you so much Lumo
Dot - a very satisfied customer

items.title: Dont read too much into the poor reviews
items.review_text: Well then, I have been on the lumo train for the first time 28/6 and 29/6. Have to say after reading many of the previous reviews I was very worried. As I was traveling with my son to a gig and thought oh no it's going to be a nightmare... Got to Newcastle station early, just to make sure if it was cancelled (like many have said) I could sort it out.. had a chat with a train guard who said everything was ok... We got on to a heaving train, but to much suprise, my luggage was able to go above us (many said there is no space) and the seats were perfect, the only bother was that not Lumos fault or any other Trainline, there was issues with over head line issues in-between York and Doncaster.. it did make us 22mins late but, we were informed of latest information as soon as the train staff were told.. have to say it was an amazing journey and the return, no problems at all.. have to say don't read too much into the poor reviews...

items.title: Strike Day. Lorry on track.
items.review_text: What a fabulous company. We were travelling from Stevenage to Edinburgh on 24th June Strike Day. I telephoned Trainline to check our train was running. They were not very helpful, in fact they cut me off twice. Stevenage staff brilliant especially Nathan. Back to Lumo trains: got the train 10 minutes earlier, had our seats thought wow brilliant and then the fiasco started from Newcastle, a lorry had overturned on the track. Was told we’d be transferred by coach. Everyone was given water. Staff very very pleasant and kept us updated that it was difficult to get coaches as it was school pick up time. 2 hours later, no coach. Taxis at our disposal to take us onto our journey. 2.1/2 hours later we arrived at Edinburgh. Thank you lumo you could not control the lorry on the track. Yes we were delayed but hey what else could you have done so thank you

items.title: Poorly service.
items.review_text: Poorly service.. don’t book from this company travels from London to Edinburgh my train suppose to be 8:52 but it cancelled but didn’t organise for us for the 10:23 train. Waiting at the station 2 hours got on the train all seats were reserved so we 6 adults 2 children don’t have a seats. We pay £370.30 for the tickets and I wanted my money refund.

items.title: What a god awful train company
items.review_text: What a god awful train company! Really don’t want to do return journey with them. Uncomfortable and understaffed. Just travelled from London to Edinburgh with 3 rowdy stag parties. The staff though understanding were unable to restrict the amount of alcohol the guys brought into the train and consumed. 4 1/2 hours of shouting singing (awfully)Lumo’s advice was to call the police. Want a refund for return journey so can get tickets with LNER. If you want comfortable travel avoid Lumo at all costs!

items.title: Horrible service
items.review_text:
My train from Edinburgh to London was changed, so that it only went to Newcastle. 
I was not informed of this, and neither were the train staff at Edinburgh Waverly (they tried their very best to help, but didn’t have the information from Lumos, so there wasn’t much they could do). 
There were multiple people on the platform that also had tickets to London, and also weren’t informed of the change. 
No trains were running back to my town as it was so late, so had to get a bus back and wasted a whole day.
Will definitely stick to LNER, they have reliable service and actually communicate with the customers and staff.

items.title: Absolutely appalling
items.review_text: Absolutely appalling, had to leave our 2 cases in another carriage anyone could of taken them, especially these days. LNER for me all the time, loses LUMO in all directions.

items.title: Brain tuned to porridge.
items.review_text:
My first Lumo experience.
Over 4 hours trapped in a very small space with such a loud continuous booming noise (what is it??) that it was impossible to work, sleep, read or even think.
Arrived very stressed feeling I had been subjected to some kind of deliberate mental brain-washing.

items.title: My seat was double booked
items.review_text: My seat was double booked, apparently it’s an issue that is happening with many. There’s no space for any decent luggage storage, which is ridiculous seeing as this is a train that travels from Edinburgh to London. The loos were in a state, no tissue paper or running water. The staff are lovely but they have to work in such poor conditions and they have to deal with these circumstances just as much as we do. This isn’t good enough Lumo.

items.title: I am appalled by this company
items.review_text:
I am appalled by this company. I am supposed to travel today but my card was stolen from me yesterday and now they are saying that the ONLY way for me to travel is to rebook trains. They have said they cannot guarantee a refund, nor can they get me a spot on my original train (despite having the tickets). The only solution is to lose these tickets, rebook the trains (which cost £200 more than the price I had booked at) and HOPE FOR A REFUND, but not make up for a difference.

I will be missing a friend's wedding for this. Appalling and heartbreaking.

items.title: I guess you only ever get what you pay…
items.review_text: I guess you only ever get what you pay for. Seats are small and not that comfortable. Seat selection is limited, only two 4 seat tables per coach, "Customers" are now called 'guys' or 'pal' or 'luv'. Train crew uniform makes them look like portly security guards.

items.title: I am a very regular traveler from…
items.review_text: I am a very regular traveler from Newcastle to London and back. I tried Lumo 3 times,  each time worst than the last, before I gave up. It is so cramped your practically sitting on each other. The cart service which is the only way to obtain a beverage or some food never comes. This is due to insufficient luggage space, the train becomes rammed with people's luggage which is anywhere and everywhere, so the cart can't get through. The luggage problem makes it hard to exit the train as you may have to put your luggage 2 carts away. I would seriously spend the extra £ and travel in comfort with LNER.

items.title: Great Staff
items.review_text:
I booked a Lumo train from Edinburgh to Kings Cross without realising via trainline
The train was severely delayed but I just wanted to praise the Lumo staff. Only caught one name, Karen (the crew changed at Newcastle) but she and her colleagues were amazing. They stayed on the platform, walking up and down making sure they gave everyone information - even though they didn't know much more than we did.
They stayed calm, friendly and did everything they could to help to keep spirits up. They were a real credit to the company.
As for the journey once the train arrived and got going  well it was fine. Train was clean and comfy and the staff continued being attentive and friendly.

items.title: Non stop Newcastle to Kings Cross
items.review_text: Non stop Newcastle to Kings Cross. Friendly staff. Comfortable seats. All passengers had same sense of humour which made the journey better. Downside was some loos out of order but announcement made so we all were kept informed

items.title: Amazing service and great
items.review_text: Amazing service and great, friendly staff. Fast train and everything perfect in general. I travelled from Edinburgh to London Kings Cross and I will use Lumo again soon for sure!

items.title: LNER is better
items.review_text: I actually booked Lumo by accident - I booked a return trip from London to Edinburgh and selected LNER for the outward journey and LUMO for return without realising (I have always done the trip on LNER both ways before) Prices were actually similar for both when I booked and I went on time rather than price. The LNER journey was so much better and no more expensive than Lumo as I booked in advance. I really wish I had booked LNER for both trips. Lumo is cramped with no room for luggage - other people had already stacked all their luggage above our seats when we got onboard. There are very few seats with tables - I always try to book 4 seats around a table as I travel with my 3 children, it makes for a much easier and relaxed journey. Aisles seem cramped, the trains old and run down.  In short I will always book LNER in future even if it costs more!

items.title: Lack of toilet paper!
items.review_text: Not impressed with such a long journey train having no toilet paper in the loo!? And only 1 hour within our 4.5 hour journey! That's in-excusable & surely a bare essential item you should be providing your customers.

items.title: We arrived 2 mins prior to departure…
items.review_text: We arrived 2 mins prior to departure and they didn't let us in

items.title: Train cancelled at the last minute
items.review_text: Train cancelled at the last minute, sent on an alternative service cross country back from Newcastle to London via Leeds with an added three hours on the journey and a three quarter of an hour wait at Leeds.  These people dont know how to run a train service!

items.title: Last minute cancellation
items.review_text: Train cancelled at the last minute with absolutely no warning - sent on an alternative route with a long layover adding 3 hours to our journey time - absolute joke and terrible customer service…

items.title: One toilet working on whole train
items.review_text:
One single toilet working on the entire train. The host said she couldn’t guarantee how long this would last because they ran out of water.

Apparently the train was too busy to open the trolly service. This happened on the outbound and return journeys. 

Have children? Don’t bother with Lumo.

items.title: ABSOLUTELY POOR NO SPACE NO WIFI NO…
items.review_text: ABSOLUTELY POOR NO SPACE NO WIFI NO SERVICE NO WORKING FOOD TROLLEY NO RESPONSIBILITY.

items.title: Great Journey to London!
items.review_text:
Based on my experience the service was good on board, staff very friendly. Seats were not that comfortable but it's a train and was economy. Plugs for charging. Toilets clean. 
I paid £75 roughly return from Edinburgh to London Kings Cross. Amazing value! 
On the return journey home there was an accident on the track near Newcastle, so we were waiting at Newcastle for an hour and a half. Lumo refunded everyone's ticket on the train. Thank you Lumo. Will use this service again!

items.title: I'll be avoiding Lumo in future
items.review_text: I travelled on a Lumo train today for the first time, from King's Cross to Edinburgh.  I was wondering how a Lumo train would differ from a normal one.  Here are the differences.  1.  There is very limited luggage space.  Staff moved my suitcase to a different location far from where I was sitting and turned it upside down.  Only small bags are allowed on the overhead racks.  If the staff find a bag in the wrong place, they hold it up in the carriage and shout "Who owns this one?"  2.  There is no buffet.  3.  There is only one toilet per carriage.  Expect to queue to use the loo.  4.  The seats are all airline style (there are no tables) and have enormous headrests.  This means that thoughout your journey you can see nothing in front of you except a large piece of plastic inches from your face.  5.  There is little legroom.  6.  The arm rests are only an inch wide and so your body may well be hard up against that of the stranger next to you.  My ticket was £38.90.  The lack of luggage space and the staff moving your luggage about make the journey stressful and the lack of a buffet is a pain.  In future I will be careful not to book a Lumo, even if it means paying more.  (I have since discovered that there are restrictions on luggage.  No one told me this beforehand.)

items.title: Consistent
items.review_text: As part of First at least the experience was consistent with that on their GWR and Avanti routes. How they are allowed to run other services when the ones they have are so unpopular baffles me. LNER next time.

items.title: Only getting 2 stars because it was the…
items.review_text:
Only getting 2 stars because it was the cheaper option. Sadly this is the Megabus of train travel (although admittedly I use Megabus for the fact I can travel 400 miles for £10). Anyway, train was packed from Edinburgh to London, with not enough luggage space. 5 coaches representative of those trains in India except no hanging out of the windows . Toilets soaking wet, rude staff and manky carpets which is ridiculous given that these trains have only been in service for 6 months. 
The audacity to charge £5 for a quarter bottle of (disgusting ) wine. The Hitachi trains are crap but granted that’s not the operators fault. Seems like the UK has gone from pioneers of train travel to having egg on their face. We seem to have degraded rather than upgraded. What an embarrassment from the great days when it really was ‘British Rail’

items.title: Spend the extra money on a more…
items.review_text:
Spend the extra money on a more reliable and established service. 

The trains have been repeatedly late, the staff have been more agitated and rude and the quality of the seats are poor.

items.title: Absolutely shocking service
items.review_text:
Absolutely shocking service. Staff were rude from the second we got on the train til the second we left. Had absolutely no customer service skills at all and was almost like they're trained to be rude and hostile towards their customers. The train was chaos before we'd even left with around 10 announcements that were very passive aggressive and rude, and sounded like all customers were being told off. It was genuinely like it was such an inconvenience for the staff to board the train. 

I fell asleep and was rudely and aggressively woken up by the ticket man who didn't even gently nudge me, but very forcefully woke me up and was shouting at me to see my ticket. Baring in mind this was 6 in the morning, absolutely no need for that behaviour. He continued to be rude throughout the whole interaction and no apology for his behavior or for waking me up so aggressively. 

Staff were just very very rude the whole time and didn't seem to enjoy their job or want to be there. Most of them definitely didn't have a clue how to do their job as well. It was a very unpleasant experience and I've never received such bad customer service in my life. 

Train was also delayed by 40 minutes but apparently we are not entitled to any compensation. Not to mention as well that the train is cramped and very uncomfortable. 

I get that they're cheaper than LNER and Avanti but really not by much, just pay for them and don't bother with lumo as you'll be getting much better service. Already complained to lumo but doubt I'll get any kind of response from them as they don't seem to care at all for passengers. 

Still so so shocked with the absolutely appalling service I received and can guarantee I will not be using them again.

items.title: Michelle & Leah incredible service
items.review_text: Michelle & Leah thank you so much!! Incredible service and fun from these two wonderful ladies. Travelled king’s X to Newcastle. Best journey of my life.

items.title: Good service from Lumo
items.review_text: Travelled up to Newcastle on the 14.48 on Monday just gone for the Newcastle, Arsenal game and back again on the 07.57 back to London next morning (today) - staff on the train were great (from the North East no less) train was packed both ways but they managed everybody really well and provided a trolley service both ways. The only thing to remember is that any train service is part of the main rail infrastructure (which has its faults) and that's beyond Lumo's control and people expect a lot for very little. Me and my friend concluded we'd definitely use again next season. Thanks to the staff on board in particular!

items.title: I would rather walk next time than use…
items.review_text: I would rather walk next time than use this service! Staff should get the guillotine, the chairs are as comfortable as a cheap hotel toilet, and they will charge you for LUGGAGE!!! Horrible staff, I hated the entire 4 hours to Edinburgh!

items.title: Awful experience
items.review_text: Awful experience. The train has no luggage space and passengers are jammed in like sardines. Luggage was stacked up against the doors, blocking gangways etc. Is that even legal? I'll never use this train again.

items.title: This was quite good actually
items.review_text: This was quite good actually. I booked on the Train Line app expecting it to be a good deal on Avanti so hadn’t heard of the company before. It was a pretty solid service. Arrived on time. The lovely team of Geordie ladies all really welcoming, in a way you’d maybe get on a flight but not so much on a train. An important part for me, I travel between London and Scotland with Avanti regularly and it can be a fight to the death getting a power point, which for a trainload of people on a 5 hour train is an absolute joke. Lumo have a power point at every seat so thumbs up for that. Can see lots of negative reviews but my experience was quite the opposite. Tip Top 👌

items.title: Never again......
items.review_text: I have now used lumo twice to travel from Edinburgh to London and on both occasions the return journeys have been cancelled due to a fault with the train. On the first occasion last year we simply got on the next available LNER service and I was even able to book a seat - so annoying but not that inconvenient. Today I received no email regarding the cancelled train even though I booked directly with lumo, whilst people who booked with train line had been advised.  On arriving at the station the  information desk advised we should again be able to travel on the next LNER train but to try and book a seat. On going to the ticket office LNER staff said this was not happening and we would have to go and catch a train from Euston - a lady in the queue had tried that and they were not accepting any further lumo passengers. We were then told we would have to go on the next lumo (2 and a half hours later) but could not book a seat and everyone may not get on. So I ended up buying a ticket for the next LNER train that I could book a seat on (2pm) There was no lumo representative at King's Cross and all Lumo's contact centre could offer was advice to call and complain which I intend to do but would have preferred customer service on the day. The LNER staff said these cancellations were happening more and more and basically that you get what you pay for. I won't be using this service again.

items.title: Traveled KX to Edinburgh and back down
items.review_text: Traveled KX to Edinburgh and back down, luggage space is almost non existent train feels absolutely cramped, very uncomfortable journey… and is not even that much cheaper, will be avoiding lumo trains in the future

items.title: Our first trip on Lumo with our dog Louie
items.review_text: My sister and I and our dog Louie have just used the Lumo train service, from Kings Cross to Newcastle for the first time, going on 29/4 and returning 2/5. We were unable to reserve any seats but going we had a really helpful member of staff called Andy who found us two seats in the corner, so we were able to get Louie comfortable. He also helped with our luggage. Thank you Andy. Coming back on the 2/5 the train was already crowded with passengers from Edinburgh, luckily we had a brilliant member of staff called Lindsay to help us. She guided us through all the carriages and found us two seats, all on our own and we were able to lay Louie's bed out for him, we had room for our luggage and plenty of leg room. We felt like 1st class passengers and it made the journey really relaxed and comfortable. We just wanted to say a huge thank you to Lindsay, her kindness and caring manner will not be forgotten and we will always be grateful. She even got off the train to say Goodbye to Louie. Lumo you should be very proud of your staff.

items.title: First time I've used this rail company
items.review_text: First time I've used this rail company. Booking in advance the return fare from Kings Cross to Edinburgh was extremely good. Allocated seat, offered refreshments, overall very satisfied with the service.

items.title: On time
items.review_text: Travelled 24th April 2022 KX to Edinburgh. On the positive, Lumo train was on time and clean.  But packed, with very limited space for luggage.  Seats pretty uncomfortable. Not sure I would use Lumo again, prefer LNER.

items.title: Dear train journey Lumo customer care,
items.review_text:
Dear Lumo customer care,
I would just like to tell you how impressed we were with your staff on our train journey on Friday 8th of April 2022.
On arrival at Newcastle central station at 10.30 am we were directed to platform 4 by station staff we waited and enquired of the station staff which train we needed for our journey and were told the next train to pull in to platform would be one we needed so we boarded the train and settled in our seats we departed  from Newcastle , just outside Durham our tickets were inspected and to our shock and dismay we were told we were on wrong train Edinburgh to London kings cross express and would not be stopping , we were going to a family wedding in York 

Your Lumo staff Sam Bentley, Steven and your train DriverAaron  said they would see what could be done , after some communication with network rail permission was given to Aaron to stop at York ,words can’t explain how grateful to old aunties stumbled off the train to a waiting concerned nephew ,Steven especially Sam were exemplary-allaying  our fears, escorting us through the train to the naughty seats by drivers cab while we awaited the decision we even were entertained by an American magician showing us card tricks some Scot’s guys offered to open the windows and drop us out you couldn’t make it up, it brightened up a stressful and worrying journey, as we hadn’t been on a train in years ,we cannot thank your staff enough for their kindness Sam Steve,and Aaron we would love to use the Lumo service again but think two elderly sisters would need minders on our next journey 

With grateful thanks and
Kindest regards 
Anne Cross and Mary Pickup

items.title: Worst customer experience ever
items.review_text:
In November last year I booked return tickets to Edinburgh. Within an hour or 2 of booking I realised the return train date was wrong and I wanted to cancel it and rebook. As it was within the first 24hrs I was eligible for a refund and was advised via their live chat tool that I could complete a refund request and get it back in full. I filled in the form and it confirmed it was being processed. 

When I realised I still hadn’t received the refund by January this year, I contacted them and they advised initially I didn’t qualify for a refund, when I shared the chat transcript from my first case they advised I actually was eligible and that they’d send me a cheque in the post because they can’t do a bank transfer refund.

6 weeks later I still hadn’t received the cheque, I got in touch with them again and they told me they’d left the flat number off the cheque and would reissue it. Another 5 weeks later, I still hadn’t received a cheque so I contacted them again and they said they’d need to cancel the second cheque to reissue and would email me to confirm, an email I’m still yet to receive.

In amongst all of that I submitted a complaint form, no one got in touch with me but I then received a survey from a third party asking me to rate how my complaint was handled.

I then contacted them on social media who gave me a customer service email address, it took a month for them to reply with an answer that obviously highlighted that they hadn’t read any of the cases I’d shared with them because all the answers were in them, including the fact I’d never collected the tickets and that I qualified for the refund. Please note, I was advised in one of the earlier cases that if I had retrieved the tickets I wouldn’t have qualified for the refund. So even their CS team contradict themselves.

It’s been 6 months since I first got in touch with them and it’s still not resolved.

Genuinely, it’s the worst customer experience I’ve ever had from a company, it seems like a complete clusterf*ck. It baffles me they can only operate using cheques despite paying by card and that they rely on ‘industry standard’ SLOs (service level objectives) with a response time of 28 DAYS to justify their complacency!!

It’s actually a shame because the first part of my journey on their train was actually quite pleasant.

items.title: Caught the 10.20 London to Edinburgh…
items.review_text:
Caught the 10.20 London to Edinburgh train on Saturday the 16th of April. We got to the train 5 mins before departure. The 2 staff members  that were on duty male and female couldn't have done enough for us a total credit to Lumo trains. Sorry I didn't catch there names but my wife and would like to thank them ever so much for there professional and friendly outlook toward us. 5 star 
Jim and Lorna

items.title: Incredibly cramped which just says…
items.review_text:
Incredibly cramped which just says exactly what their priority is: getting as many people on the train as possible

Not accomodating for large cases which requires awkward placement in-between carriages that needs staff to help - not convenient at all

items.title: No legs space, worst train journey in ages!
items.review_text:
I got a Lumo train from King's Cross to Newcastle on Saturday 16th April for the first time. I liked the idea of an electric train, better for the environment.

My first experience on a Lumo will be my last, this train was awful. The metal tables to not stay fixed and constantly fall down. Also, this train was clearly designed for very small people. I am 6ft 3" and the table which I could not stow away, was lower than the top of my knees whilst sitting straight. It was really uncomfortable. For 3+ hours it was hell. I had to lay down in my chair for the table not to touch my knees.

There was no food car and it took 1.75 hours before the food trolley reached us. 

Awful service. I would rather pay double than use this train again.

items.title: Absolute trash!
items.review_text:
Absolute trash!! Not enough space for luggage. The upper shelf to leave the hand bag is poorly designed, yeah a suitcase fell into someone in the middle of the trip.
Well, but at least is cheaper? No really cost the same that LNER

items.title: Late trains happen but how it’s handled can make it a nightmare
items.review_text: Due to travel from Edinburgh to London on Lumo. Train was apparently delayed due to having to unexpectedly having to empty some tanks BUT the passengers were left on the platform for the train which was still shown as being on time. Finally a train arrived but we were then screamed at by LNER staff as it was their train not the Lumo one. I tried contacting Lumo customer services via online chats but confusingly she told me my train didn’t exist as LNER had no such departure time. This despite her being clearly labelled Lumo customer service on my screen. After a while of no info the train finally arrived but after this I will never use Lumo again. It’s cheap but you get what you pay for.

items.title: Terrible - just avoid Lumo entirely
items.review_text:
We booked two tickets from Newcastle to London in advance on a specific train. Strangely there was no option to reserve seats. 

At the station we found the platform swarming with people waiting to get on the train. There was nowhere to sit and passengers could only get on if they were willing to stand up the whole way. This was a non stop three hour journey! 

Lumo staff were neither helpful nor apologetic. We had to buy another ticket for on the day travel with LNER. We did eventually get a refund from Lumo for the cost of the tickets but this was only after being refused three times through their online refund claim system and finally getting a resolution via email. We were of course out of pocket for the difference in cost between the lumo and LNER tickets we had to buy last minute.

This was our first experience of this new operator and it’ll be our last.

items.title: Train almost de-railed
items.review_text:
The train jerked 5 times outside of Peterborough today at around 11am; all the bags fell off onto people and people were screaming, bracing for impact. We were gravely afraid for our lives.

It was delayed for 90 minutes with no explanation from the driver, and the PA was only used after 30 minutes with no explanation but just a promise we’ll be up and running again soon. Highly incompetent and unprofessional. Refund was provided. 

Avoid travelling with Lumo if you value your life.

items.title: Poor Support Service
items.review_text: Was given a recommendation to use Lumo by a friend and booked 2 single tickets Kings Cross to Edinburgh and back. Could not take the journeys as I was ill so went on-line to claim e-vouchers to use at another time. They require you to cut the tickets in half, lay on a white background, take photo and upload to them as part of the process. Got an e-mail back saying that the return ticket was approved but the outbound ticket was a duplicate of the first. I then called their support team number (not listed anywhere) but it is 0345 528 0409 - best to call Sundays. I explained that they were not duplicates. Received an e-mail the following day from the case worker that he had made a mistake and could see that they were not duplicates but stated that the image of the ticket was of such low resolution that the ticket references couldn't be read and that I needed to send another one with a higher resolution. I've e-mailed back informing that the resolution is perfect and exactly the same resolution as the ticket that was approved, and to avoid the same at their end I listed all the ticket reference codes (4 in total). Still waiting for a response 4 days later. Complete shambles of a service.

items.title: Utter shambles
items.review_text:
I was unable to collect a ticket due to the ticket machine not allowing me to present my card. I contacted customer service but they were unable to help, other than suggest I buy another one!

As I had to travel I therefore bought a second one for the same journey but at a higher cost. They are refusing to refund me the cost of that second ticket on the basis that it's my fault. A complete shambles of a company and the matter is being taken to the Ombudsman.

items.title: Terrible service, months of chasing them
items.review_text: I bought some tickets with Lumo directly in December, having seen that I could change my tickets online anytime before the train - perfect for COVID changing times. We decided driving was more safe the day before the train and tried to change our tickets to early 2022 that evening. The website wasn't working so I took screenshots to prove this and emailed them to Lumo and woke up very early the next morning to try again. No luck and Lumo got back weeks later to say they could see that we had tried but because it was past the train they couldn't give a voucher. I obviously contested this and after months of bad service I contacted the rail ombudsman. Promptly got a response from them saying that I could have a refund. Seems as though they are able to provide service but only when prompted by a larger power than themselves. Not only did this take months of me prompting them but it was terrible service. I would love to be able to charge them for the time I have taken to chase them up (eve though I had good evidence of the fact it was their website's fault) but I am content to now have a refund. Thanks to the ombudsman.

items.title: Train kings cross to Newcastle very…
items.review_text: Train kings cross to Newcastle very busy, chock a block with luggage, toilet in carriage not working. Seats and armrests are smaller than LNER, not a great difference in price so will continue with LNER from now on, ok if you’re on a really tight budget, maybe need to put more carriages on

items.title: Toilets dirty on both trains and no…
items.review_text: Toilets dirty on both trains and no toilet roll - really in 2022?

items.title: Best for us so far 👍
items.review_text: We’ve travelled from London to Edinburg with Lumo in March 2022That was our first experience with this train company. Advantages: much more space in between seats, super friendly staff, good variety of snacks and drinks. We’ve travelled up north with different companies before but this one is the best so far (for us). It’s a shame that they don’t cover other destinations in the UK.

items.title: Problems:
items.review_text:
Problems:
Noisy train 
NO QUIET COACH
Armrests are too small 
Seats are too small
Tables are too low 
Only one charge point per 2 passengers 

In summary: suitable for small passengers wanting a noisy uncomfortable journey. 

Absolutely not suitable for commuting - I will never travel on LUMO again and will advise friends and family to avoid.

items.title: Love Lumo!
items.review_text: Fantastic journey. Lovely staff (Jemma and Jo). Seats were way comfier than LNER, thought I was in first class! Reading light is great little addition. Ill definitely be coming back! Awesome it was in train line so smooth ... awesome service u guys rock

items.title: Great experience
items.review_text: Great trip from Newcastle to edinburgh today. The train was almost empty never had such a peaceful journey. The staff were lovely.

items.title: Chockablock and everything slides off…
items.review_text: Chockablock and everything slides off the tables constantly.

items.title: The most horrible train ever
items.review_text: The most horrible train ever . If you have a ticket problem or something else there is no help . No single person from this sh**  company is there in King-cross or any  station. I think Ghosts operate it

items.title: Good trying to speak with someone.....
items.review_text: Been attempting to contact live chat for 3 days now. Utter waste of time. Refund process gives contradicting info on the website too. Trying to give off the look of a modern company with it's slick branding however its the same old rail company shambles behind the veneer

items.title: God help you if LUMO forget to send you…
items.review_text:
God help you if LUMO forget to send you your Eiticket.
I bought a ticket in December 2021 and forgot to check if LUMO sent me the ticket.  I checked my email, SPAM and everything.  No ticket.  Contacted LIUMO via online chat (they do not accept phone calls) and was told that 2 days before my journey, I will have to get a refund and rebook at a much higher rate

items.title: Better Seats than LNER, but limited catering
items.review_text:
Used Lumo for a return journey from London Kings Cross to Morpeth and return.  There is good and bad with Lumo.  Fare was competitive, staff really friendly and seat more comfortable than the hard seats on LNER - there are also 'wings' each side of the headrest to rest your head.  However seats would be more comfortable still if they were covered in wool moquette, like the majority of train seats rather than less comfortable flat-cloth.  On-board catering very limited - best to purchase something at the station / in advance and take it on board.  Luggage space also an issue, though I think part of the problem is compared to rival LNER with has short distances between stations with many passengers are travelling on day trips, with less luggage, on Lumo with the longer distances between stations, most passengers will be staying away and hence there is more luggage per passenger on average.  Lumo should have thought of this and provided more luggage racks especially at the end of the coaches where there are no windows.  By far the worst thing with Lumo is there is no choice in seats when booking, so can end of with an aisle seat or whatever when you would rather have a different seat.  Fortunately there were some empty better seats when I travelled, so I was able to move.
Note that some reviewers booked Lumo with thetrainline - why do that?  With the thetrainline when booking in advance you will always pay fees which the train companies do not charge when booking direct, so you are just wasting your money using them.

items.title: Comfortable seats and great service
items.review_text: Comfortable seats and seat trays. Incredible customer service form the absolutely Lovely staff on the train. I didn't catch the man's name, but he was checking tickets in coach C and was especially nice to me as I had my dog with me. I caught the 10:45am KX to Edinburgh Waverly so shout out to you my man

items.title: Excellent service, the BEST out of the rest
items.review_text:
Travelling from Edinburgh to London. I found that the customer service is excellent.They are the best, way above LNER and others.
The are really friendly, helpful and they have a personal approach to everything. Other train operators need to send their staff on training days with them.

items.title: Got caught up in the London Underground…
items.review_text:
Got caught up in the London Underground strike and despite allowing almost three hours for a 20 minute tube trip, I missed my train by 10 minutes. The Lumo staff were charming and understanding and I went on the next train without any additional charge. What a difference some humanity makes on a difficult day, thank you. 

The trains are clean and spacious and also on time. All in all a first class experience. Thank you.

items.title: Newcastle to York
items.review_text: We were travelling from Newcastle to York today and by mistake got on a non stop Lumo train to Kings Cross London!!! The on board staff member, Gemma, came to our rescue and arranged for an unscheduled stop at York. There were a few other unfortunate travellers made the same mistake. We will be forever grateful to Gemma and Jack for seeing us off at York safely. Really excellent service from Lumo staff.

items.title: Great journey
items.review_text: I traveled to Edinburgh on a Lumo train from Morpeth. Although there was someone asleep across my seat (covered with a blanket!) I found another seat easily (better seat, actually) The staff were fab and I loved the points of interest from the driver. The tea from the trolley was the best train tea I've had! Free KitKat when I bought my second cup, too! I'd happily recommend Lumo trains.

items.title: Llegamos tarde a nuestra reserva con en Edinburgo!!!
items.review_text: Hoy martes 22 de febrero tomamos el tren de king's Cross a Edinburgo, 10.45. Debíamos llegar a Edinburgo a las 3.17pm pero aun estamos en viaje debido a problemas con la formación por lo cual debimos cambiar de tren y luego hubo un accidente de un pasajero al bajar en una estación. Realmente nos sentimos perjudicados y no recibimos ningún tipo de atención debido a los inconvenientes ocasionados. Es la primera vez q viajamos por esta línea y realmente no cubrió mis expectativas para este viaje.

items.title: Totally a nightmare experience
items.review_text: Totally a nightmare experience, the train keep delay and delay and spoil my journey! Never consider this suck train!

items.title: I travelled to London from Morpeth on…
items.review_text: I travelled to London from Morpeth on the 9th of February on Lumo train and it was a positive experience for me : the train arrived on time, very clean inside, comfortable seats, friendly staff, refreshments trolley with hot drinks and snacks. Will definitely use their services again.

items.title: Lumo eats is a cheat
items.review_text:
The train itself is very good.
Clean.
However, we bought twice 2 Bottega Prossecos and got a bag of crisps complimentary as advertised on trains PA and paid 10£. So we paid 10£ each.
On the third time after the Newcatle they charged us 13£ for the same thing.
I mentioned that to the crew amd asked why they are evercharging us, they said it must have been a mistake from the prior train attendants.
I am open to explain asnI have all credit card charges and I dont want other people fall into this type of cheat/overcharge.

items.title: Appalling customer service
items.review_text: Train service cancelled with no notification. Told to email in tickets. No response. Been on hold for 45minutes now...

items.title: The seats were really comfortable
items.review_text: The seats were really comfortable, the toilets clean and the staff especially courteous.

items.title: I paid for my son and I to go home from…
items.review_text: I paid for my son and I to go home from kingscross to Morpeth and got there plenty of time went to platform 5 grand central train in dock no sign of lumo train and I know what one looks like as travelled before , I asked public waiting for grand central if they had seen the lumo train to have a conductor tell me it’s just left as it was parked up in front of the train already in station and couldn’t travel until following morning so devestated no extra funds had to borrow money to then buy from LNER more train tickets to go long way round and as a vulnerable adult it made me very I’ll I want my tickets reimburse and what I had to pay out as no signs to say it was infront of another train

items.title: Took  the lumo train from kings cross…
items.review_text: Took  the lumo train from kings cross to Newcastle booked through train-line 10.45am departure. I travel a lot and can honestly say the staff on this train were the best I have ever encountered (one a young Geordie and older guy with white hair). Polite, courteous, professional and generally cared about the passengers. A credit to your company

items.title: sold me a ticket for a train that…
items.review_text:
sold me a ticket for a train that didn't exist? impossible to get hold of, so unable to claim a refund.

I brought a ticket from the lumo website, when i arrived at the station i'm told Lumo have no trains running that day due to scheduled track work? therefore I have to purchase another ticket to get back to london. There's no option covering this in there complains, and no options to type my own experience. They have not replied to any of my emails, and i was on hold for 2 hours and 10 minutes... no answer? So i cant claim my money back. 

so basically, I've been scammed out of 149 pounds. 

According to the train staff at Edinburgh, this is common place for Lumo.

items.title: Good experience so far.…
items.review_text: Booked through LNER app as I couldn’t access the Lumo app. Chose service as it was the cheapest, one of the fastest and time from Kings X on a Friday (12.18) was around the time I wanted to travel. This was the 3rd time I have used Lumo for travel to Newcastle and back to London. Never had a problem . I don’t travel with luggage but can see passengers with excessive luggage struggling. Like the fact that it is booked seats only-no more arguments on busy LNER trains with walk ons taking booked seats. Trains always have space as it would appear that there are a number of no shows. Staff always friendly and like the update from driver about progress. Can’t comment on customer service issues as I have had no need to contact but have noted that you can’t move your booking if,for whatever reason, you can’t travel-you lose your money. It’s good to have more competition on this route as LNER can be very expensive.

items.title: Tried to book ticket using their…
items.review_text:
Tried to book ticket using their website and could not not!

They advertise 1218 from Kings Cross but I could not book it using their app!!

Not a good start for a new operator, guess I and others will go back  use standard apps like Trainline and LNER?

items.title: Travelling with Lumo as part of a Birthday Treat
items.review_text:
Travelled yesterday and today with Lumo to London from Newcastle and back as part of a birthday treat to see a show in London.
All I can say is that having travelled to London during most of my working life by various Train Operators, the Lumo experience is amazing. Welcomed on board as if part of the family, great trolley service, comfortable seats, equally as good as other operators.
I loved the little touches like the driver talking to passengers about why we had gone slowly from York to Thirsk and it was cos the train was actually too far ahead of schedule. He also advised us that one of the crew had her birthday today, so everyone wished her happy birthday as she passed through with the trolley. A great and friendly experience and would book with Lumo again when we are back to London in March.
We were dead on time at the end of both trips so what more could you ask for. Well done guys, keep up the good work…

items.title: Had tickets for 29/11/21 train from…
items.review_text: Had tickets for 29/11/21 train from kings cross to edinburgh was cancelled 2 hours before had to buy additional tickets to get home as couldn't get through to lumo on phone as was told at rail desk tickets weren't transferable, had to spend 145 pounds for new tickets and have been trying to get a refund every since as it does state on their website they would reimburse any additional costs as long as you have receipts, they are a nightmare to get hold of either on the phone or email I have taken it to trading standards. Terrible customer service will not be using them again.

items.title: AVOID - No Compensation!
items.review_text: Lovely train, really impressed. Staff great, but any problems and your stuffed! We booked through Lumo, had an issue, entitled to compensation and they merely didn't accept responsibility and referred it to LNER. Haven't heard a peep since 12 Dec 21. Appealed through Lumo, nothing (its a complete headache by the way). Avoid and go through LNER!!!

items.title: Total shower of shxt of a company
items.review_text: Total shower of shxt of a company, god help you if you need to contact them waited over an hour on the phone and gave up. I would never use this company again LNER trains are way better with superb customer service and nothing is to much trouble for them. STEER CLEAR OF LUMO

items.title: Cheap but dreadful train service
items.review_text:
First, despite being a brand new train, it may be the worst I’ve ever been on. To get the price down, they have clearly chosen to reduce the quality of the service. The seats are okay, they get a plus for decent winged headrests but they are VERY narrow seats so it is unavoidable to make contact with the person next to you. 
Now, the main issue, there is a severe lack of luggage space, to the point where it is almost a joke. I took the train from Kings Cross to Edinburgh and clearly people are going to be bringing luggage, I myself had just come from Heathrow. This made boarding the train a nightmare and absolute chaos. During this, the staff were very rude to myself and other customers, complaining that we had brought too much luggage and berating us for it. According to the rude staff, they have a 1 bag per passenger rule… which isn’t advertised anywhere. It seems baffling to me to a train company that only operates long distance services, from a major transport hub (which also houses an international train station!), has sacrificed luggage space for a couple of extra seats.
Despite the slightly lower price, I will not be travelling with Lumo again. LNER trains are not great by any means, but Lumo is significantly worse.

items.title: Avoid at all costs
items.review_text: I didn't realise I was booking a Lumo train or that they're insane about luggage, because I booked via trainline. Nobody travels without luggage from Scotland to London?! Trains are horrible and packed, staff are awful, avoid at all costs.

items.title: Took the Lumo train from Edinburgh to…
items.review_text:
Took the Lumo train from Edinburgh to London on Jan 2 evening. It was on time, clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. The seats had a very useful innovation - tables that pulled an extra 6 inches with a mini lamp fitted in the seat back, both very useful for working on a laptop. 

I had no problem fitting my rucksack on the overhead luggage rack. (though I did see luggage piled up in a disorganised heap in a hatch at the end of the carriage) 

The only criticism I have is that there were no sandwiches available on the trolley service (only if you had pre-ordered them, which is too much of a bother) - the only savoury item was crisps. My favourite fruit cake which I always buy on train journeys was not available either.

Overall, though, I was pleasantly surprised.

items.title: CS team doesn't reply to the emails
items.review_text: customerexperienceATlumo.co.uk is a ghost email address

items.title: Great if you don’t take luggage
items.review_text: Who travels to Edinburgh or Newcastle from London with no luggage? Simply not a usable service due to their terribly poor stance on luggage. Next time I plan to travel without taking anything with me, I’ll be in touch, otherwise I’ll pay the extra to go on a service that lets you take a case on. Before you reply, I’m aware of your Lumoluggage sit to pay £14 a bag. It’s laughable. Dreadful journey, no help and never again will I stand the whole journey due to not having anywhere to put my case. Joke company!

items.title: The booked train didn't even EXIST!
items.review_text: Bought return tickets from London to Edinburgh for Dec 27th and via The Trainline. The outbound journey was with Lumo. Tickets were issues, all good. The Trainline even sent notifications on the day about the journey. Got the train station - there is no train! It wasn't even scheduled! It just didn't exist. So we had to buy expensive tickets on the spot for an alternative train. There were more passengers on our new train that had experienced the exact same problem. The Trainline say it's not their problem. Have written to Lumo - not impressed!

items.title: Cancelled my train 10 days before it…
items.review_text: Cancelled my train 10 days before it was due to go, even though i have an all day all time ticket i can not use it on any other carrier, i was then told all other lumo services are also cancelled so they have 'automatically' refunded me the ticket price. I bought the ticket in advance at a very good rate - i will now have to pay double and half to get back to london as the price of tickets are obviously inflated at short notice. Terrible communication, ambiguous email to tell me 'a change had been made' not that all lumos had been cancelled, there is 'nothing else' i can do.

items.title: Improve your communication Lumo Giving one star because Lumo has not…
items.review_text: Giving one star because Lumo has not liaised with booking sites such as Trainline to pass on important info about their service. I booked through Trainline and was therefore unaware that I needed to preorder food beforehand. The only food available on a four and a half hour journey from London to Edinburgh were crisps and snack bars.

items.title: Xmas train journey from London to…
items.review_text: Xmas train journey from London to Edinburgh-obviously it was going to be busy. However this is like the Ryan air of the train world- adding more seats and reducing luggage storage. Large bags falling off overhead shelving onto people followed by staff moving bags to other carriages to make space- but not informing their owners! I had put my bag in a baggage rack behind me and ended up spending forever at Edinburgh trying to locate the bag and missed my connecting train.

items.title: Absolute Disgrace - Do Not Use Lumo
items.review_text:
Absolute Disgrace - Refused refund for a train that was cancelled stating I actually travelled. Well yes I did travel, on an alternative train at an additional cost to me of £120 booked on the day of travel.
I still used return tickets so only claimed refund for cancelled train yet still refused. 
No communication from Lumo to inform of the cancellation prior to travel either. Yes it was a Trans-Pennine Train but Lumo took my money !

items.title: As a regular traveller on this route I…
items.review_text: As a regular traveller on this route I was pleasantly surprised. Clean, more leg room than normal, friendly/cheerful Geordie staff, trolley service , overall great. 1 Adult and 2 children with family and friends card under £100 rtn. Thanks Lumo

items.title: No mask wearing enforced.
items.review_text: No mask wearing enforced.

items.title: Worst trip ever!
items.review_text:
Worst trip ever!

There was a group of people partying in the train, they didn't respect COVID guidelines of wearing a mask, and the staff didn't say nothing. 

Apart from that, there is no wifi service!

items.title: i looked on the website and cannot find…
items.review_text: i looked on the website and cannot find any cheap tickets? only for over 100 and looking for much cheaper> is there any number you can call?

items.title: Amazing service thank you.
items.review_text:
The train assistance aboard my 10.51 train from Newcastle to London Kings Cross or Tuesday 14th December could not have been more attentive. They were approachable at all times, very friendly and complimentary. The train was clean and tidy. 

Thank you again to the train staff I’d love to be friends!

items.title: Party in train from Edinburgh to London
items.review_text:
The train from Edinburgh to London was one of the most upsetting journeys I have ever had.

Since the departure, very early in the morning before  8 am,  a large group of people were drinking alcohol, talking very loud, moving constantly along the train, with music on a speaker! and lots of alcohol drinks. The scene was unbelievable, because the staff didn't tell them to stop the music or turn it down, they even had laughs and fun with them instead. It was impossible to rest, work or have videocall work meetings, so be very careful if you have to be working on your way to London. Thank god they got off the train in Newcastle, it was so annoying, and how the staff acted was very inappropriate, why do we have restrictions if things like this can happen without any kind of sanction, punishment or at least reprimand?

This happened the 4th of November, and I am writing writing a review right now because I initially contacted Lumo about this issue and they took several weeks to make a proper reply.

So, if you have to be working, or you would like to rest on your way to London, be very careful because probably there is a party going to Newcastle and the staff won't do anything, leaving the rest of the passengers annoyed and unable to have a comfortable trip.

items.title: No refund after asked to cancel my journey 2 days before
items.review_text: I bought tickets to travel on 1st 0f December from Edinburgh to London with LUMO. Unfortunately I couldn't make the trip from London to Edinburgh (another company). Due the storm over last weekend, my trip was cancelled. I tried to cancel my journey with Lumo 2 days before the date and your answer was: "unfortunately we cannot find a record of your ticket based on the evidence from your application and have therefore been unable to process your refund." I sent a copy of my e-ticket. How it is possible you couldn't find a record of my ticket? I will never travel with this company again

items.title: Excellent service
items.review_text:
My first time on this train to London from Edinburgh.  Must say that I’m really impressed by the service.  It’s clean, punctual, with conductor and trolley service frequently.  Only two other stops till London.  I booked early without realising this is a new service.  Compared with my other recent trip on the same route using LNER this is definitely improvement! Having seen the few negative reviews I thought I should give my experience - I’m writing this on the train!

Ps: I’m not sure you need new names for driver and conductor on lumo trains! You just need sustained better service we will recognise you!

items.title: Cheap is too good a word for Lumo
items.review_text:
My partner is currently travelling down from Newcastle to London on a Lumo train.  On booking, he wasn't given an option to reserve a seat. Seems like this is the case for over half the passengers on board.
Lumo obviously have sold over double the amount of tickets as all seats are taken and all aisles and corridors are full of people standing.
There are families with young children sitting outside the toilets and a woman with disabilities having to sit on her suitcase.  People are having to stand the whole 3hr trip.
Lumo sells itself as a low-cost rail operater but disgusting how they make money by cramming everyone in like sardines.  Cheap is one thing but having no consideration for passenger safety and welfare is another.  Everyone on the train is not happy.
We are regular train users but we definitely will not be travelling Lumo again until they sort out their booking system and putting a cap on how many tickets can be sold.  Will stick to LNER.

items.title: Utter garbage of a service and no…
items.review_text: Utter garbage of a service and no customer service to speak off especially when there are issues. First time I have used it and the train had a fault and didn’t turn up. We were then directed to a packed LNER train leaving an hour later. That train got into Edinburgh at 1617 when the original train should have arrived at 1427. You would then think claiming the delay would be simple. Their website is awful. Makes you waste a lot of time which I assume must be to deter people from claiming. I claimed and only just received an email saying they disagreed with my delay claim and say it was less than an hour so will be refunding me half my ticket value - oh how kind and incompetent. Wonder how they think that happened. To appeal you then have to go through the same tiresome process of reloading ticket, etc. Clearly they are not cut out yet to be running a company if they cannot even deal with the simplest of events. They have now wasted a lot of my time but at no point has there been an apology. We were treated like rubbish at KX. Stick to LNER as Lumo is clearly not ready and make it very hard to contact them.

items.title: Got sucked in by the promo…really regret it
items.review_text:
Got sucked in by the promotional cheap tickets from London to Edinburgh and regret it. The customer service takes forever and is useless. Of course their advice is: we cannot help, but you can book another ticket (at an inflated fare). 

Cheap in more ways than one. No way to get in touch by phone, so long waits for a response. Which means prices rise a lot by the time they give you that helpful suggestion.
